recipe.title: SAUCE PIQUANTE
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful French sauce with a balance of sweet and savory notes.

Steps: Brown the pork belly pieces in oil on moderate heat for a few minutes. Discard the meat pieces and pour off the excess fat.
Reduce the heat, add butter and then carrots, celery, onions, thyme, and mushrooms (if used). Cook for 1 or 2 minutes.
Stir in flour. Toasted flour can be used to avoid cooking the flour but if using untoasted flour, cook the roux on low heat for a few minutes.
Add tomato paste and mix. Cook for about a minute.
Add stock and white wine. Bring to boil and reduce on low heat for 15-20 minutes.
Place shallots, wine, and vinegar in a pan and on high heat reduce to about half the volume.
Add 300 ml of the sauce base to the pan and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
With heat off, add herbs and gherkins and whisk together. Allow herbs to infuse after which the sauce is ready to use.

recipe.title: Garlic Mousse
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: An airy and flavorful garlic paste perfect for topping dishes or using as a dip.

Steps: Pulse the whole garlic cloves with the salt in a food processor for 20-30 seconds.
Gradually incorporate half of the oil while the food processor is running, adding it little by little to ensure the mixture remains smooth and does not split.
Add half of the lemon juice and process for 30 seconds to emulsify. Then, continue adding the remaining oil and lemon juice.
Once finished, you should have an airy, mousse-like garlic paste.

recipe.title: Bistro Pepper Steak
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: reduced brown beef or veal stock

recipe.description: A classic bistro-style steak dish with a flavorful sauce and perfectly cooked meat.

Steps: Ensure the steaks are at room temperature before you start cooking.
Season the steak by rubbing both sides with salt and pepper to taste. Leave to rest for at least 10 minutes to allow the steak to absorb the pepper.
Thinly dice the shallots and get your mise en place ready.

On medium heat, warm one tablespoon of oil in a good quality frying pan and fry the steak for 2.5 - 3 minutes on each side (depending on your desired level of doneness). ONLY TURN THE MEAT ONCE, and do not move the meat around while cooking.
When the steak is nearly done, deglaze the pan with the cognac then remove the steaks and keep warm in an oven at 70C (158F).
Reduce the heat under the pan to low and melt the butter. Add the shallots and stir in for 5-10 seconds.
Add the white wine and turn the heat up a little. Deglaze and reduce the wine for about 30 seconds.
Add the stock on high heat, reduce again for about 2 – 2 ½ minutes to get a syrupy consistency.
Add cream to taste and reduce again for 1 – 2 minutes.
Add the steaks (including the juices) to the sauce in the pan and coat both sides to warm them.
Place each steak on a plate, pour over the desired amount of sauce and serve with potatoes, rice or fries.

recipe.title: Beet Salad
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A simple yet elegant beet salad with the sweetness of orange and the freshness of tarragon.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Coat the beets with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of sea salt, then wrap them in foil. Roast for about 1 hour or until a knife slides in easily. Let the beets cool slightly, then peel off the skin by rubbing with your hands or a paper towel.

Slice the beets into wedges or rounds and place them in a mixing bowl. Drizzle with orange juice, white wine vinegar, and olive oil. Toss gently to coat and leave to macerate in the fridge for 15 minutes.

When ready to serve, arrange the beet slices on a plate using a food stacker if you'd like a more structured presentation. Add a few orange supremes, sprinkle with tarragon and chives, and season with sea salt and black pepper to taste. Finish with a touch of orange zest for extra citrus pop and a final drizzle of olive oil.

recipe.title: Landaise Potatoes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Rich and flavorful potatoes cooked in duck fat with the added textures of ham and mushrooms.

Steps: Melt the duck fat over high heat in a sauté pan or large cast iron skillet.

Rinse and completely dry the potatoes, then add them to the pan and sear on high heat for 10-12 minutes until golden brown. Then, add the ham and onion, toss well, and cook for a further 2 minutes. Now, add the mushrooms, toss again, and cook for a further 3 minutes.
When done, reduce the heat to low and continue to cook the potatoes covered for about 20 minutes (or until cooked through), tossing the potatoes in the pan every 5 minutes or so.
Just before serving, raise the heat to high and add the crushed garlic and parsley. Mix well and leave to cook for roughly a minute before transferring to a serving dish.

recipe.title: Poached Fish with Vermouth
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A delicate and flavorful poached fish dish with a tangy vermouth sauce.

Steps: Season the fillets with salt and pepper. Place them in a sauté pan, sprinkling with chopped shallots, butter cubes, and about half the parsley.
Pour the vermouth into the pan, cover with either the lid or a parchment paper lid, and heat to a simmer.
Reduce the heat and cook until the fish is cooked. Once cooked, baste the fillets with the wine stock and reserve them on a plate.
Add a little more stock and cover. Bring the remaining stock in the pan to a boil over high heat and reduce for a minute or two to concentrate the flavors.
When the stock is reduced to a tablespoon or a little more, add the cream and reduce further for about a minute.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Stir in the remaining parsley and turn off the heat.
Return the fish and accumulated cooking juices back to the pan. Turn the heat onto low and return to a simmer to reduce the sauce further if required.
Serve the fillets on a plate with the sauce ladled over.

recipe.title: CHICKEN BAKE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Baked chicken with mushrooms and cream sauce.

Steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F).
Melt butter and olive oil over high heat and sauté the chicken to colour both sides, then remove the chicken from the pan leaving behind the cooking juices.
Now cook the onions in the same pan over medium-high heat for around 10 minutes until brown and set aside.
Add the remaining butter and olive oil to the pan. Thickly slice the mushrooms and cook with the seasoning, sage, and thyme for 5 minutes until the mushrooms are evenly browned.
Return the onions and chicken to the pan along with the port wine. Deglaze over high heat until the juices have evaporated.

To make the bechamel, first melt the butter over medium heat, then add the flour and mix well. Reduce the heat and cook until the roux becomes brown in colour (around 3 minutes). Now add the milk a little at a time, whisking constantly to avoid lumps.
When the sauce becomes smooth, bring to the boil over medium heat and cook for exactly 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour the bechamel into the pan over the ingredients and mix in the cream.
Transfer the ingredients to a baking dish and spread the cheese evenly on top.
Cook in the oven for 20 minutes, then under the broiler (grill) for a further 2 minutes to crisp the cheese. Serve with a side of pasta or salad.

recipe.title: Crème de Tomates
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A French-inspired tomato soup with a creamy twist.

Steps: Thinly slice the onion. Remove the hard-top core of the tomatoes and cut them into small chunks.
Melt the butter in a saucepan on medium heat together with the water. Add the onions and cook on low heat for up to 15 minutes until the onions are completely cooked but not brown.
Add the thyme, peeled garlic clove, tomatoes and sugar, raise the heat to medium and cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Turn the tomatoes from time to time.
Pour in all the stock, mix everything in and boil for 2-3 minutes. Then remove the thyme.
Either use a stick blender to blend everything in or pass the mix through a vegetable mill. If using a blender make sure to pass the liquid through a sieve to remove the tomato skins and seeds etc.
Return the liquid back to the cleaned saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Meanwhile, whisk the egg yolk and the cold cream together in a large bowl until integrated and then pour in the hot soup base whilst whisking well. Whisk together for 1 minute.

Return the mix again to the cleaned saucepan and bring to a light simmer on medium heat whilst stirring or whisking. Whisk for 3 minutes so the soup slightly thickens, but take care to ensure it does not boil.
If you wish to add colour to the soup stir in a tablespoon of diced fresh tomato. Season to taste.
If desired, pass through a sieve again into a dish, and then serve.
Garnish with a dollop of cream, herbs and croutons.

recipe.title: BURGUNDY CABBAGE SALAD
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A refreshing salad with crunchy cabbage, sweet apple, and savory bacon.

Steps: Remove all the outer leaves of the cabbage. If desired, cut out the ribs of the inner leaves and then julienne those leaves after washing them.
Make the dressing – grind salt and pepper to taste in a bowl, add the vinegar and stir in to dissolve the seasoning, add the oil and blend in and then whisk in the cream (50 ml for a small cabbage).
Dress the cabbage and reserve in the fridge.
Pan fry the lardons until coloured, and set aside.
Peel and core the apple and cut into small cubes. Fry the cubes in the butter in a fresh pan and colour them in a small amount of butter on high heat.
Remove the cabbage from the fridge and mix in the lardons and apples.
Garnish with chopped chives, squeeze lemon juice over and give a final mix.

recipe.title: STUFFED BELL PEPPERS
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and nutritious side dish filled with rice, herbs, and nuts.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C/400°F. Brush the inside of the bell pepper halves with olive oil and season. Bake for 15 minutes, until slightly softened.

In a frying pan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until soft and translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Stir 3 quarters of the chopped nuts and cook for another minute.
In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice, onion mixture, chopped tomatoes, raisins, the chopped parsley, mint, dried herbs and smoked paprika. Season to taste.
Carefully spoon the stuffing mixture into the roasted bell pepper halves, filling them to the top. Pour about ¼ cup of water into the bottom of the roasting tray to create steam and prevent sticking.
Reduce the oven temperature to 10°C /380°F and bake for 20 minutes, then take the dish out of the oven and sprinkle the almond meal and remaining chopped nuts over the bell peppers.
Drizzle with a little more olive oil and bake for an additional 15 – 20 minutes, until the almond meal becomes golden and crispy.
When ready, remove the tray from the oven and let the bell peppers cool for a few minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining chopped parsley and any optional garnishes of your choice and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Sauce Bercy
recipe.creator: unknown
recipe.description: Classic dish with beef steaks and tangy sauce.

Steps: Heat up the stock and thicken with the arrow root. Preheat your oven at 70 °C (160 °F).

Add the butter to a sauté pan over high heat. When the butter starts to brown slightly, add the steaks and cook to the desired level of doneness. Cover the steak on a tray and keep warm in the oven while making the sauce.

To make the sauce, use the pan used to cook the steaks. Over medium heat, add the shallots and leave to cook for 20 seconds. Then turn the heat to high, deglaze with the wine and reduce the liquid until you have 1-2 tablespoons remaining.
Add the thickened stock and reduce to a spoon coating consistency. Turn the heat off, correct the seasoning and finish the sauce by adding the butter (and extra wine if desired).
Serve the sauce unfiltered over the steaks with a sprinkle of parsley. Serve with salad and sautéed potatoes.

recipe.title: Boeuf Bourguignon
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French beef stew cooked in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon.

Steps: Season the meat pieces generously.
Macerate the lardon in madeira wine for 30 minutes or more (optional).
To make the toasted flour, place the flour in a small saucepan over high heat and stir constantly until it turns a chestnut color and starts to smell nutty.
Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over high heat, and then sear the beef in batches on all sides until dark brown. When done, set the meat aside in a plate for now.

Using the same pot, add a little more oil and sear the mushrooms until golden, and then add the onions and let cook for about 5 minutes until they become lightly colored. When done, remove from the pot and set aside.
Now, add the bacon to the pot and sear for a few minutes.

Return the beef to the pot and mix in the tomato paste to enhance the colour. Deglaze with the madeira wine (optional) and leave to reduce for a minute before stirring in the toasted flour. Mix well to incorporate.
Add the mushrooms, onions and bacon back to the pot and stir everything gently to distribute the garnish around.

Finish by emptying the bottle of wine into the pot, and if necessary, top up with water so that the liquid just about covers the meat. Then, add the rind, bouquet garni, carrots and garlic. Bring to a light boil and use a spoon to scoop off the foam that has accumulated on the surface.
When ready, turn the heat off, cover the pot with a lid and place in the oven. Slow cook for 3 hours, undisturbed, until the beef is tender and can be easily pulled apart with a fork.
When cooked, remove from the oven and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Serve with potatoes rice and some crusty bread for the sauce with a glass of red wine (of course).

recipe.title: Mayonnaise
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic condiment made with egg yolk, oil, and seasonings.

Steps: Whisk the vinegar, salt, and pepper, egg yolk, and mustard in a large bowl for about a minute to start the emulsion process.

When well mixed, add a little oil and whisk until emulsified and then add more oil in stages, ensuring that for each stage the oil is fully incorporated. Continue to add oil until all the oil is used and the mayonnaise is firm.
You can add a dash of lemon juice which will make the mayonnaise whiter and give a tang.
Other options to flavor the mayonnaise is to add things such as paprika powder, chili powder, curry powder, and even garlic (for a cheat aioli).

recipe.title: Braised Short Ribs with Port Wine, Star Anise & Cinnamon
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender short ribs braised in a rich port wine and spice sauce.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 160°C (325°F). Pat the ribs dry and season generously with salt and black pepper.
Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat and sear the ribs on all sides until deeply browned—about 3–4 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Reduce the heat to medium-low, remove the excess fat, add the butter followed by the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery to the same pot. Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes to release the aromas.
Stir tomato paste, cooking for another 30 seconds to remove the excess acidity.
Deglaze with the port wine scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Let it simmer for about a minute to reduce slightly.

Return the ribs to the pot, then add the beef stock, cinnamon stick, star anise, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring everything to a gentle simmer, cover, and transfer to the oven. Braise for 3 hours until the meat is fork-tender and nearly falling off the bone.
Once done, remove the ribs from the pot and reserve on a plate covered with foil to rest. Discard the cinnamon stick, star anise, and bay leaf stir in 100 ml of port extra in the pan.
Filter the sauce through a sieve to discard all the garnish.
Skim off any excess fat from the sauce. Reduce the sauce over medium heat in a small pan to a semi syrupy consistency adjusting the season or taste to your liking with extra stock and port if needed.
Serve the ribs with the rich sauce spooned over mashed potatoes or a creamy polenta. A glass of red wine on the side wouldn’t hurt either.

recipe.title: Crème Brûlée
recipe.creator: Unknown Chef
recipe.description: Rich and creamy custard base topped with a caramelized sugar crust.

Steps: Cook the milk and heavy whipping cream mixture to a boil then turn off the heat.
Separate egg yolks and mix with granulated white sugar. Mix until yellow color is achieved.
Cool the milk and cream mixture to lukewarm, then mix with yolk and sugar mixture.
Pour the mixture into ramekins and bake at 100℃ for 45-60 minutes.
Tap test: gently tap the side of the ramekins to check if the center wobbles. If it does, it's done.
Remove from oven and let cool to room temperature then refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Before serving, sprinkle brown sugar on top and caramelize using blowtorch, broiler or flambé method.

recipe.title: Steak Tartare
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Steak Tartare is a classic dish that's perfect with toasted bread or as part of a simple salad.

Steps: Mince the beef filet in a food grinder or by hand with a knife. Keep it cold in the refrigerator whilst preparing other ingredients.
Whisk together egg yolk, mustard, and olive oil.
Add all other ingredients to the bowl and whisk them in. Then add seasoning and mix well.
Place minced meat in another bowl and mix dressing into it.
Eat as is.

recipe.title: Braised Pork with Apples and Prunes
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: crème fraîche or heavy whipping cream

recipe.description: Tender pork shoulder braised with apples and prunes in a rich sauce.

Steps: Preheat oven to 160 C (320 F).
Insert prunes into cavities of the meat. Sprinkle with pepper and salt. Roll and truss securely with string.
Sear the meat in a cast iron pot over medium heat for 3 minutes on each side. Remove and set aside.
Cook onions in the same pot over low heat for 3 minutes. Add garlic, thyme, bay leaf, and half of mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes.
Raise heat, deglaze with cider, and reduce by 3 minutes. Add remaining prunes. Return meat to pot and cover.
Bake in the oven at 160 C (320 F) for about an hour. Halfway through, remove and flip the meat.
Check temperature of the meat by inserting thermometer into its center. Continue cooking until it reaches 70 C (158 F).
Fry remaining mushrooms with butter and salt until golden. Fry apple quarters gently for 5-10 minutes.
Transfer meat to a tray, cover with foil, and let rest. Reduce sauce in pot over high heat until syrupy. Whisk in cream.
Glaze the meat before serving: use juices from macerated prunes to baste the meat and glaze under grill for best results.

recipe.title: Shallow Poached Fish
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Shallow poached fish with a flavorful sauce.

Steps: Season the fillets with salt and pepper. Place them in a sauté pan. Sprinkle with chopped shallots, butter cubes, and about half the parsley.
Pour the vermouth into the pan and cover with either the lid or a parchment paper lid.
Heat the pan to a simmer. Reduce the heat and cook until the fish is cooked. Once cooked, baste the fillets with the wine stock and reserve them on a plate. Add a little more stock and cover.
Bring the remaining stock in the pan to a boil over high heat and reduce the stock for a minute or two to concentrate the flavors.
When the stock is reduced to a tablespoon or a little more, add the cream and reduce further for about a minute.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Stir in the remaining parsley and turn the heat off.
Return the fish and accumulated cooking juices back to the pan.
Turn the heat onto low and return to a simmer to reduce the sauce further if required.
Serve the fillets on a plate with the sauce ladled over

recipe.title: Old Fashioned Macarons
recipe.creator: French Baker
recipe.description: Classic French meringue-based cookie with a delicate shell and chewy interior.

Steps: Blend almond meal and sugar together with a flat wooden spatula.
Add egg whites and mix until a paste is formed.
Pipe the paste onto a silicon mat in small mounds.
Dab water on each mound and gently flatten them to the same height.
Preheat oven to 180C (365F). Bake for 15 minutes.

recipe.title: Cheese Beignets
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A sweet treat made with fresh cheese, sugar, and flour. Perfect for a snack or dessert.

Steps: Mix the fresh cheese with the sugar to remove lumps and smooth it out.
Add eggs to the mixture and whisk until smooth.
Sift in the flour and whisk until a smooth batter forms.
If too runny, add extra flour until thickened.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Heat sunflower oil or a deep fryer to 170°C (340°F).
Fry dough balls in batches for 3-5 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
Drain and cool on paper towels. Roll in sugar for added sweetness.

recipe.title: Parisian Flan
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French dessert with a creamy custard base and caramelized top.

Steps: Whisk eggs and sugar together until the mix becomes whitish (a cream-like color). Then add the starch (corn flour) and incorporate into the mix of eggs and sugar.
In a sauce pan on medium to high heat, pour in the milk and cream mix, add the vanilla pod split open (make sure you scrap the beans out and add them too) and bring to the boil.

As soon as the milk reaches boiling point turn the heat off, remove the vanilla pod then pour the milk over the egg mix a little at a time while whisking gently and continuously. Keep on going until all of the milk is incorporated.

Using the same pan you used to cook the milk, pour the mix you just made back into the saucepan. Turn the heat on medium-high and bring to the boil while stirring continuously with a wooden spoon. Very quickly the mix will thicken and start to boil and when it does turn the heat back on low and keep cooking for 5 minutes, while whisking continuously, then turn the heat off.

Pour all of your cream into a clean cold bowl and cover with plastic wrap to the touch (meaning your plastic wrap has to be in contact with the cream to avoid a crust forming on top). Let the cream cool down. You can place it in the fridge to accelerate the process.

If you want to use a crust: Prepare a tart or pie dish by coating it with a little bit of butter then lightly dust it with flour. Then lay down the puff pastry or shortcrust in the tart or pie dish. Crustless version: Coat your cake tin with butter and cover with parchment paper (as demonstrated in the video)

When ready, remove the cold pastry cream from the fridge and whisk so that it becomes more workable. When done, fill the dish with the pastry cream. Flatten the top with a spatula to make sure the surface is even. Bake the Parisian flan at 170 to 180 °C (338 - 356 °F) for 35 minutes or until a golden crust has formed on top.
The most important tip for a delicious Parisian flan is allowing it to cool before serving. It tastes best when chilled.

recipe.title: Mustard Sauce
recipe.creator: Anonymous
recipe.description: An alternative to the hollandaise-based mustard sauce, this home cooking version is based on a béchamel and is much easier to do.

Steps: Melt the butter in a pan, and once melted, reduce the heat and stir the flour into the butter to make a paste and cook for 2 minutes
Turn off the heat and allow to completely cool (putting it in the fridge is a good idea)
Halve the shallot and stand a clove into each half
Put the milk into a pan and add the shallot halves, the thyme, the bay leaf and salt and pepper On a medium heat, bring the milk to a simmer
Once simmering, remove from the heat and pass half of the milk through a sieve into the other pan containing the paste
Off the heat, whisk all together until all is incorporated then whisk in the remaining milk
Turn the heat to medium low and start to thicken the roux, whisking all the time
After it comes to a light boil, continue whisking for another minute or two then reduce the heat to very low and incorporate the cream
Add the vinegar and the mustard and stir it in (from this point onward the sauce should never be boiled)
If necessary adjust the consistency by stirring in more cream, and if desired, add some extra Dijon mustard for a more yellowish color and a more pronounced mustard taste

recipe.title: Gratin d'Oeufs
recipe.creator: French Chef

ingredients.id: salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipe.description: A rich and creamy French dish with eggs, mushrooms, and a flavorful sauce.

Steps: Clean and slice the mushrooms.
Prepare the Béchamel sauce (see recipe on our website).
Boil the eggs for exactly 9 minutes, then place them in cold water to stop cooking.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they soften and any liquid has evaporated. Pour in the white wine and simmer until it reduces, leaving a flavorful mushroom mixture. Season with salt and pepper, then set aside.
Stir the heavy cream into the Béchamel sauce you’ve prepared and mix well. Strain the mixture through a sieve into a clean saucepan.
Prepare the Hollandaise sauce using your preferred recipe and set aside.

Gently heat the sauce crème and Béchamel mixture. Peel and slice the eggs, adding them to the warm sauce. Once the eggs are heated through, carefully fold in the Hollandaise sauce, stirring gently with a wooden spoon or spatula. Keep the sauce warm but be careful not to let it boil, or the Hollandaise may split.

Preheat your oven’s broiler. Use individual ovenproof egg dishes or a larger shallow baking dish. Spread a layer of the egg mixture at the bottom, top with the cooked mushrooms, and cover with more creamy sauce.
Broil until the top has light brown patches. Serve immediately, garnished with fresh chives or parsley.

recipe.title: PETIT FLAN
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and creamy dessert made with eggs, milk, cream, and bacon.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 200C (400F) (fan-forced).
Cut the bacon into lardons and sizzle in a heated pan until brown and crispy. Transfer to a plate and dry on a paper towel to absorb some of the excess fat.
Grate the cheese, but not too thinly, so that it gives some texture to the dish.
Beat the eggs in a bowl, add the milk and cream and beat in. Season to taste and stir in the bacon and cheese.
Coat each ramekin with butter and ladle in the egg mixture so that it almost reaches the top of the ramekin.
Place the ramekins into a container suitable to use as a bain marie (e.g., a pie dish). Pour boiling water ¾ of the way to the top of the ramekins.
Place the bain marie into the oven and cook for 15 minutes.
Eat directly from the ramekin with a spoon or enjoy spread onto toast or croutons.

recipe.title: French Hot Chocolate
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Warm and rich French-style hot chocolate with a hint of cinnamon and vanilla.

Steps: Heat the milk in a saucepan on a medium to high heat, adding the cinnamon bark and vanilla essence at the beginning.
When boiling point is reached, reduce the heat to a minimum, stir and simmer for 10 minutes with the lid off.
Turn off the heat and remove the cinnamon. Add a good tablespoon of cocoa powder and stir in. Filter the milk, wash the saucepan before returning the milk. Turn the heat back on.
Add a pinch of sugar and a pinch of salt. Add the chocolate pieces and stir in gently until the mix is smooth and silky.
If a thicker mix is desired, keep cooking until the desired consistency is reached.

recipe.title: Carrots with Cumin & Orange
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and colorful side dish with roasted carrots in a cumin-infused orange glaze.

Steps: Use a mandoline to slice the carrots evenly and place them in a bowl.
Prepare a cartouche by cutting a circular piece of baking paper to fit your pan. Grease one side with butter.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the carrots with cumin seeds, garlic, sugar, olive oil, and salt. Mix well using your hands to ensure everything is evenly coated.

Heat a large sauté pan over medium heat. Lay the carrots flat in the pan, ensuring they are evenly distributed. Bury the bouquet garni under the carrots. Add half a cup of water and no more—too much water will lengthen the cooking time.
Place the cartouche over the carrots, buttered side facing down. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.

Remove any excess water from the pan. Now, add half of the orange juice and cook over medium-high heat, allowing the liquid to reduce for 10 minutes. Shake the pan occasionally to help the glaze coat the carrots evenly.

Once the liquid has mostly evaporated and started to caramelize, remove the bouquet garni. Add the remaining orange juice to the pan and continue cooking until the liquid forms a glossy, caramelised glaze, shaking the pan to assist in coating the carrots.
Transfer the glazed carrots to a serving dish. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander and drizzle with a few tablespoons of additional orange juice mixed with a pinch of cumin seeds for extra flavor.

recipe.title: Lyonnaise Salad
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic Lyonnaise salad with smoked pork belly, crispy croutons and a tangy dressing.

Steps: Trim the rind from the pork belly and cut into thin matchsticks.
Slice the bread into thin slices (around 1 cm).
Wash the lettuce leaves thoroughly. Make the eggs are at room temperature before you cook them. Place them into a pot of boiling water, then time to boil for 6 minutes.
Brown the bacon matchsticks (lardons) and dry them on a paper towel.
Melt a good pat of butter. Brown the bread slices (croutons) for about 2 minutes on each side, dry them on a paper towel and rub each side thoroughly with a halved garlic clove.
Put the salt and pepper in a bowl, pour the vinegar over it and whisk in, then whisk in the walnut oil.

Put the lettuce into a bowl, pour most of the dressing over it and mix well. Place the dressed leaves into a salad bowl and sprinkle with the lardons. Place the croutons round the bowl perimeter and then add the halved eggs. Pour the remaining dressing over the eggs and croutons and garnish with roughly chopped parsley.

recipe.title: Pork Chops
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic pork chops recipe with caramelized onions and herbs.

Steps: Heat the oven to 170 °C (338 °F) fan forced.
Slice onions finely.
Melt half a tablespoon of butter in a large non-stick frying pan and add oil on medium to high heat.
Brown each side of the chops for about 5 minutes. Place them in a roasting dish.
Place all onions into the frying pan, use oil and butter and juices from cooking the chops.
Turn onions over, stir to prevent burning, season to taste.
Once caramelized (15-20 minutes), turn onto the chops and distribute garlic, sage, remaining butter, and thyme equally.
Cover with baking paper or aluminium foil and cook in oven for about half an hour.
Pour roasting pan juices over the chops before serving. Serve with potato or rice.

recipe.title: Cream of Mushroom Soup
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy and comforting soup made with sautéed mushrooms and a rich béchamel sauce.

Steps: Add the butter to a saucepan over medium-low heat.
When butter melts, add the shallots and cook (sweat) the shallots for 2-3 minutes while stirring. Avoid browning the shallots.
Then add the mushrooms and stir to combine with the shallots. Cook for 2-3 minutes.

When moisture starts to release from the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper. Continue cooking over medium-low heat and keep stirring the mushrooms so they release most of their moisture (about 10 minutes). Turn the heat off when the mushrooms just begin to dry and set them aside.

To make the béchamel sauce, start by preparing a roux. Add some butter to a small saucepan over medium-low heat. When the butter melts, add the flour and mix to combine. Cook for two minutes while stirring occasionally and then turn the heat off and set the saucepan aside to allow the roux to cool.

Now you need to make a flavoured milk for the béchamel. In another saucepan, add the whole milk, 2 small bay leaves, ½ onion with cloves, sea salt, black pepper and a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg. Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a gentle boil while stirring. The flavored milk is ready when the onion starts “dancing” or bobbing around.
Remove the milk from heat and let it rest/infuse for 5 minutes. Remove the onion, cloves and bay leaves after infusing.
Add the roux to the flavored milk and whisk to combine.
Place the saucepan over medium heat and, while whisking constantly, bring the béchamel to a simmer. The sauce should start to thicken slightly when ready.
Place a fine-mesh strainer over a pot of cooked mushrooms and slowly pour in the béchamel. Use a rubber spatula to help scrape off any sauce stuck to the saucepan.

Mix to combine. Use a stick blender to further break down the mushrooms and help extract more flavor. Another round of straining and pressing the mushrooms through the wire mesh sieve adds more flavor and smoothness to the soup.
To finish the soup, add 3 ounces of milk and some whipping cream and mix well to combine. Gently heat to a simmer over medium heat. Adjust the seasoning to your taste.
This creamy mushroom soup can be served in a bowl with croutons, a small nub of butter and chopped parsley. A drizzle of dry sherry or port wine further enhances the flavor.

recipe.title: Marengo
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with juicy chicken, tangy tomato sauce, and savory mushrooms.

Steps: Brown the chicken bones in a pan with olive oil for 10 minutes. Then add water and scrape the bottom of the pan to detach the caramelized meat juices.
Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Brown them in the same pan for 5 minutes on each side.
Prepare the sauce by adding garlic to the pan, then cognac, and finally the chicken stock. Reduce the sauce until it's semi-syrupy. Add chopped tomatoes and mix well.
Cook the chicken in the sauce over low heat for 15 minutes or more, turning every 5 minutes.
Pan-fry mushrooms and bread pieces with olive oil to make garnish. Fry eggs separately.
Serve one or two pieces of chicken per person on a plate covered with tomato sauce. Garnish with sautéed mushrooms, croutons, and topped with a fried egg.

recipe.title: Legendary Entrecote Sauce
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A creamy and herby sauce perfect for serving over grilled steak and fries.

Steps: Finely chop the shallots and strip the leaves from the thyme and rosemary sprigs. Add them to a saucepan over low heat with the butter and the rest of the herbs.
Season lightly and let it cook for about 5 minutes—you want everything to soften and turn translucent, but not brown.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the crème fraîche and Dijon mustard. Pour in the warm, herby butter mixture, followed by the lemon juice and water. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Place back on the stove on very low heat to Keep it warm and serve over grilled steak alongside fries and a side of green lettuce.

recipe.title: Potato Leek Saffron Soup
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy and flavorful potato leek soup with a hint of saffron

Steps: Cook the onion for 3 minutes. No coloration.
Add the leeks, potatoes, spices, and stock. Season to taste.
Simmer on low heat for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are cooked.
Blend with wine and cream. Sieve if desired.
Simmer again. Add lemon juice and adjust seasoning.
Serve with chives and olive oil.

recipe.title: Quiche au Fromage
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic quiche recipe with a creamy egg filling, Comté cheese, and Italian Fontina cheese.

Steps: Prepare a short crust (storebought or handmade).
Grate the Comté and cut the Fontina and soft blue cheese into medium size cubes.
Prepare the migaine (egg and cream filling) by pouring the cream into a large bowl, beating the eggs, and whisking them with the cream.
Season the migaine with salt, pepper, and chives.
Sprinkle the grated Comté over the base of the quiche crust, followed by the cubed Fontina cheese.
Gently ladle the migaine over the cheeses, filling the pan almost to the top.
Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15 minutes, then reduce temperature to 180°C (356°F) and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
Let the quiche cool at room temperature for up to 2 hours before slicing and serving.

recipe.title: Mussel Soup
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and comforting mussel soup recipe with saffron threads.

Steps: Prepare a large pot for cooking the mussels.
Wash and scrub the mussels to remove any grit stuck to the shells. Cut off the hairlike seaweed protruding from the clasp of the mussel, known as the beard
Heat the butter in the pot over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the parsley and wine and increase the heat to high to bring the liquid to a boil.
Add the mussels to the pot, ensuring they are coated in the liquid by stirring with a wooden spoon. Cover the pot with a lid and cook the mussels for 6 minutes, shaking the pot occasionally.
Once the mussels are cooked, transfer them to a bowl and set them aside.
Filter the remaining cooking juices through a fine mesh sieve, or cheese cloth, into a bowl to remove any grit and reserve the liquid.

In a separate pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for two minutes before adding the carrots, leek, and fennel. Cook the vegetables on low, stirring occasionally, until they become soft and translucent (approximately 5 minutes). Now stir in the flour to thicken the ingredients slightly, then add the thyme and bay leaves.

Pour the mussel cooking juice and fish stock into the pot with the vegetables, followed by the chopped tomatoes. Stir to combine the ingredients and bring to a boil. Add a sprinkle of pepper and simmer for 15 minutes to concentrate the flavors and thicken the soup.
Filter the soup through a fine mesh sieve into a medium-sized saucepan, pressing the garnish firmly with the back of a spoon to extract as much juice as possible.
Place the saucepan over high heat and add the star anise, cream, and saffron. Bring the soup to a gentle boil, then leave to simmer for a further 10 minutes.
To serve, place a handful of mussels (shell removed) in each serving bowl and ladle the soup over. Garnish with parsley and enjoy with a side of toasted baguette.

recipe.title: Braised Fennel
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Braised fennel with a hint of wine and herbs, perfect for a simple yet flavorful side dish.

Steps: Remove stalks from the fennel, then thinly slice off the end. Take care not to slice it too thickly to avoid the outer skins of the bulb being dislodged.
Peel off the outer layer of skin, then halve the bulb lengthwise and again into quarters.
Blanch the bulbs by placing in boiling salted water for 3 minutes, then scoop them out and drain in a sieve (the fennel will be fragile so avoid using tongs for this).
Heat some oil in a grill pan and place the fennel face down to achieve those nice looking grill marks.
Combine the wine, water, coriander seeds, bay leaf and thyme and seasoning in a pan over a medium heat and bring to a simmer.
Cautiously place the fennel pieces in, drizzle with the olive oil, then cover the pan and allow the dish to steam for 35 minutes until a knife easily pierces the fennel.
Baste the fennel with the pan juices before serving with a spoonful of pan juices and a drizzle with lemon.

recipe.title: Hanger Steak Parisian Style
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Pan-seared hanger steak served with a rich shallot sauce and garnished with parsley.

Steps: Clean the meat by trimming the skin and excess fat.
Slice steak away from the chewy tendon strips and keep in the fridge.
Thinly slice the shallots along lengthways.
Chop the parsley finely.
Preheat the oven to 70C to 90C.
Pan fry the steak in heated oil on medium heat for 2 – 3 minutes each side.
Place the steaks in a dish, cover with foil and keep warm in the oven.
Reduce the heat to medium and melt the butter in the steak juices.
Add the shallots and cook gently for 3 - 4 minutes, then add the vinegar and reduce the liquid by half.
Add the salt and parsley and mix in.
Remove the steaks from the oven and pour the steak juices from the dish into the pan with the shallots and mix.
Slice the steaks into 1 - 2 cm (1/4 inch) thick pieces, assemble on a plate spoon over the shallot sauce.
Scatter some parsley on top and serve with a salad.

recipe.title: Crepes Souffle
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A French classic: delicate crepes filled with a light and airy soufflé mixture, caramelized apples, and a hint of calvados.

Steps: Prepare the souffle mixture as per the Grand Marnier souffle instructions (link above), substituting calvados for Grand Marnier. Fold in some caramelised apples before adding beaten egg whites.
Make the crepes as per the crepe batter recipe link above.

To prepare caramelised apples, melt butter in a pan on medium heat and cook apples for 2-3 minutes until coloured. Mix in sugar, pour calvados over, and ignite to flambee (with exhaust fan off). Cook for 2 minutes more.
Place a warm crepe onto a tray, spoon on souffle mixture, and fold the crepe. Bake for 8 minutes until soufflé has risen.

Open oven, sprinkle icing sugar over top of crepe, and bake for another 2 minutes to caramelize. Transfer to plate, top with caramelised apple, and serve immediately garnished with toasted flaked almonds.

recipe.title: Tian Provencale
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and colorful vegetable dish from Provence.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 200 °C (400 °F).
Peel alternate strips off each courgette to create a striped effect.
Slice courgettes, tomatoes, and onions to a 3mm to 4mm width.
Fry the onions in oil for 10 – 15 minutes to soften them.
Crush the garlic and rub it onto the base of the dish or pan and layer the fried onions on top and flatten them.
Season the onion with pepper and salt.
Layer the courgettes and tomatoes alternately on top of the onion bed so that they lean diagonally and season that layer with more salt and pepper along with the pulverised bay leaves.
Drizzle 50 ml (1.75 fl oz) olive oil over the confit.
Cook uncovered in the oven for an hour or until the vegetables have collapsed into an almost jam-like consistency.
Remove the tian from the oven, pour a little more olive oil over and let the dish cool down before serving.

recipe.title: Escargots
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A classic French appetizer of snails cooked in garlic butter.

Steps: Preheat oven to 220C (428F).
To make the garlic butter, blend garlic and shallots together, then add parsley until fine. Add butter a little at a time using a wooden spoon until smooth.
Stir in seasoning and chill to allow flavors to infuse.
Drain snails and rinse. Bring water, stock cube, thyme, and bay leaf to boil, then reduce heat to simmer. Add snails and simmer for 2-3 minutes, then remove and drain.
Assemble snails by inserting butter compound into each shell, adding a snail, and gently pressing down. Top with butter to cover the opening of the shell and smooth over with a spoon.
Place shells in an ovenproof dish on bed of rock salt and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and serve piping hot.

recipe.title: Eggs en Papillote
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A French classic where eggs are wrapped in flaky pastry and baked to perfection.

Steps: Cook the eggs in boiling water for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a bowl of cold water and let them sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Once cooled, carefully peel the eggs.

Ensure the puff pastry is cold and firm. On a clean surface, cut the pastry sheet into two rectangles, each large enough to wrap around an egg. Place one egg on a rectangle of pastry and fold the pastry over the egg, sealing the edges neatly.
If the pastry doesn’t stick, brush the edges with a little water. Press lightly on the edges with the back of a knife to secure the seal and create decorative indentations.
Repeat with the second egg.
Brush the tops of the pastry-wrapped eggs with the egg wash. Use a knife to score lines or patterns on the pastry for an elegant touch.
Place the wrapped eggs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until the pastry is golden and puffed.
Serve immediately, whole or sliced in half, nestled on a bed of your favorite sauce and garnish with your favourite herbs if desired.

recipe.title: BASQUE CAKE
recipe.creator: Unknown (Anonymous)
recipe.description: A classic Basque cake with a creamy pastry filling and a buttery crust.

Steps: Multiply the flour into a bowl and stir in the baking powder and (after sifting) the sugar.
Add the diced butter and with your fingers and hands, rub it into the flour mixture until it starts to resemble sand. Rub any buttery clumps out of the dough.
Heat the milk and the vanilla bean on medium heat and bring to a gentle boil.
Pour the heated milk through a sieve into the mixture and gently mix together and pass it through the sieve back into the pan. On a medium heat, bring back to the boil, whisking continuously.
Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and keep cooking for 2 minutes. Turn off the heat and whisk in the butter. The mixture should be smooth and thick.
Scrape the cream into a tray and flatten it out to fill the tray. Cover the cream to prevent a crust from forming and place in the fridge until cold.
Remove a disc of dough from the fridge and place it onto a sheet of plastic film and then place another sheet on top.
Roll out the dough until the round disc is a diameter of 20cm (8 inches). Place on a flat board and return to the fridge.
Turn the pastry cream into a bowl, add the rum and mix together and place into a piping bag.
Place a sheet of parchment(baking) paper on a baking tray. Remove one pastry disc from the fridge and place it on the parchment paper.

Brush the egg wash on an 18mm (3/4 inch) wide strip on the perimeter of the dough and then pipe the pastry cream to cover the rest of the disc. Flatten it with a spatula but be careful not to spread it over the egg wash.
Remove the second pastry disc and place it on top of the first disc with the pastry cream.
Seal the pastry cream in the discs by flattening the rim of the second disc on the egg wash on the first disc.
Place a high profile tart ring over the cake and push down to cut through the rim of the dough and remove the off cuts.
Brush the top of the cake with egg wash and decorate the top with four criss-cross lines gently scratched with a fork (or any design you like really).
Pre-heat the oven to 180C (356F) (fan forced) and keep the cake in the fridge while the oven is heating. Bake the cake for 45 minutes.
Remove the cake from the oven and allow to cool and remove the tart ring (if necessary, run a knife along the inside of the ring to help remove it).
Wait until the cake is at room temperature before eating.

recipe.title: Paprika Chicken
recipe.creator: Hungarian Chef
recipe.description: Classic Hungarian dish with flavorful paprika chicken and tangy tomato sauce.

Steps: Dice the onions, peel and cube the tomatoes, prepare the chicken stock.
Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper and then coat with a dusting of flour (shaking off any excess.).
Heat the oil and melt the butter on a medium heat in a pan large enough to fit the chicken pieces, and lay them into the pan skin down once and sauté to a light brown color.
Continue cooking for 5 minutes, then remove the breasts and set them aside in a tray or plate. Allow the chicken legs to cook for a further 10 minutes.

Remove the chicken legs from the pan and set them aside with the chicken breasts. Add the wine, scraping the bottom of the pan gently to detach the caramelized pieces. Leave to reduce by half and then put the chicken pieces back in the pan.
Add the paprika powder and espelette pepper (optional) to coat the chicken and then add the stock and the tomatoes.
Finish the sauce by adding the cream and stir in gently.
Remove the chicken pieces once cooked and adjust the seasoning of the sauce to your taste with pepper and salt. You can also add more paprika if you like.
Return the chicken pieces to the pan, garnish with basil or parsley and serve.

recipe.title: Poulet A La Tomate
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French dish with tender chicken and rich tomato sauce.

Steps: Coat the chicken pieces in flour.

Warm the oil and melt the butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Brown the chicken pieces, skin down (over moderate heat this will take around 5 minutes on each side). Once browned, reserve the pieces on a plate.

Cook the onions in the pan for 10 minutes until lightly brown and tender. Add the bruised garlic and cook for a further minute, then increase the heat to high and deglaze the pan with the wine cooking until most of the wine has evaporated.
Add the stock and allow it to reduce by half.
Add the tomatoes, fresh thyme and bay leaf and cook (still on high) for a further 3 minutes.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper, and if the sauce is a little acidic, add between ½ and 1 teaspoons of sugar to soften it.
Reduce the heat to medium and return the chicken to the pan. Baste them with the sauce, then cook for 20 minutes with the lid on.
After 20 minutes, remove the breasts and cook the thighs for a further 10 minutes. Then return the breasts to the pan and splash with a little olive oil. Serve with rice or pasta.
Make the grilled tomatoes while the chicken is cooking. Halve and seed each tomato and cook in a grill pan for 5 minutes on each side starting with the skin down. Season with salt and pepper.
When done, transfer the tomatoes to a plate and add a little of the sauce over each tomato half. Sprinkle with oregano and parsley before serving.

recipe.title: Pan-Seared Steak with Red Wine Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender steak with a rich red wine sauce and sautéed mushrooms.

Steps: Sear seasoned meat over medium-high heat in oil using a stainless-steel sauté pan.
Turn the meat a few times to ensure a generous amount of caramelized juices forms at the bottom of your pan.
When the meat is cooked to your liking, place it on a plate, cover it with foil, and set it aside while you prepare the sauce.
Remove the excess fat from the pan and return it to the stove, this time over low heat.
Add the shallots and gently stir with a wooden spoon to coat them in the caramelized juices.
Raise the heat to high wait for the pan to heat up then pour in the madeira wine.
Gently scrape the bottom of the pan to detach and dissolve the caramelized meat juices. Let it reduce until one or two teaspoons of liquid remains.
Immediately add the stock to the pan and let it reduce by half, stirring occasionally.
When done, reduce the heat to low. If necessary, add additional ingredients required for the type of sauce you’re preparing. For this recipe, add a handful of sauté mushrooms and stir them through.
Finally, turn off the heat, adjust the seasoning to your liking and swirl in the butter.

recipe.title: Chicken Pojarsky
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Delicious chicken cutlets with a crispy exterior and a flavorful interior.

Steps: Cube the chicken and butter and tear the white part of the bread into small pieces.
Soak the bread with the cream (or milk if used) for a few minutes. Press out any excess cream in a sieve and press down on the soaked bread with a fork to compress it.
Pulse the chicken in the processor for a few seconds, add the soaked bread and pulse again for a few seconds, add seasoning and if desired any additional condiment or onion or parsley etc.
Add the butter cubes and process again for a number of seconds for the butter to be well incorporated. Rest the mixture, covered, in the fridge for 15 minutes.

Dust a bench with flour. Form whatever shapes are desired (but avoid balls) with the mixture and roll them in the breadcrumbs. If they are too soft, return them to the fridge for about half an hour to firm them.
Fry in the butter (or a neutral oil) on a moderate heat for at least 5 minutes each side to ensure that they are well coloured.
When cooked, drain them on a sheet of paper towel.
These moreish snacks can be served with a spicy mayonnaise, or best with a soubise sauce.

recipe.title: Dijon Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender and flavorful chicken in a creamy Dijon sauce.

Steps: Melt the butter in a sauté pan or large skillet over medium heat, then sauté the chicken on both sides until golden brown.
Add the thyme and bay leaf to the pan, then pour in the wine. Cover with a lid and let it cook on gentle heat for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Scoop out the chicken pieces and place them on a tray or plate. Cover with foil and keep them warm in the oven while you make the sauce.

Pass the cooking juices left in the pan through a sieve, then return them to the pan. Let the cooking juices reduce on high heat for a minute or two. Add the cream, reduce it for a few more minutes, and then turn off the heat.
Mix the two egg yolks with a few tablespoons of the sauce, then add the mixture back to the pan and stir gently. Follow by adding the mustard and give the sauce another stir.

To finish, turn the heat back on very low. Take the chicken out of the oven and pour any cooking juices from the tray or pan into the sauce. Stir gently before adding the chicken pieces back to the pan.
Warm up the chicken in the sauce until it's hot enough to serve, making sure the sauce never boils (to avoid splitting the sauce).
Serve directly from the pan or on a warm serving dish, with a side of potato mash or white rice.

recipe.title: Garlic Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and creamy garlic sauce made with high-quality ingredients.

Steps: Peel and halve the garlic and remove the central germ.

Blanch the cloves by placing them into a saucepan containing water and salt. Dissolve the salt and bring the water to a boil on high heat. Turn off the heat and scoop out the cloves and drain on a paper towel.
Puree the garlic with either a stick blender or a small food processor – either way, process it with a tablespoon of water. Once pureed, pass the garlic through a sieve.
Put the cream into a pan and on medium to high heat, bring it to a boil. Keep it simmering until it reduces by about a third.
Add the pureed garlic in stages until the taste is to your satisfaction.
Reduce the sauce a little further and season to taste (using salt and white pepper).
If desired stir in a little more fresh garlic to increase the garlic flavor (but don’t use too much).
If desired, stir in half a teaspoon of finely chopped parsley.

recipe.title: NORMANDY PORK CHOPS
recipe.creator: Normandy Chef
recipe.description: A classic Normandy pork chops dish with caramelized apples and a tangy cider sauce.

Steps: Prepare and measure all of the ingredients. Season the pork chops with salt. Peel, core and slice the apples and place the slices in a bowl of water mixed with lemon juice. Preheat your oven to 70 °C / 158 °F.

Heat butter and oil in a frypan or skillet on medium heat. Cook pork chops for around 5 minutes on each side, then cook for another 5 minutes. This ensures the chops are cooked properly and creates lots of caramelized meat juices on the bottom of the pan.

Make the apple garnish by rinsing and pat drying the apple slices. Add them to a hot pan with butter. Season with salt and pepper and cook for about 10 minutes, tossing from time to time until they are golden-brown color.
Once the chops are cooked, place them in a tray covered with foil and keep them warm in the preheated oven while you make the sauce.

Make the sauce by removing excess fat from the pan. Raise the heat to high and pour in cider. Scrape caramelized juices sitting at the bottom of the pan so that they blend with the cider to create the sauce base (this is called deglazing). Leave to reduce for 1 or 2 minutes, then add cream and reduce again until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Adjust the seasoning of the sauce with salt and pepper to your taste. You can now add calvados to the sauce to give it more character but this is optional.

Take the pork chops out of the oven and pour all meat juices left in the tray into the pan. Place the chops in the pan and let them warm gently in the sauce for a few minutes, turning them over at least once.
To finish the dish, serve the chops with apples placed on top and pour the warm sauce over. I highly recommend enjoying this regional dish with a glass of cider.

recipe.title: SUN TART
recipe.creator: Dutch Chef
recipe.description: A savory and tangy tart with a crispy puff pastry crust and a flavorful filling.

Steps: Cut out circles from the puff pastry sheets. Place on a tray and cover with parchment paper. Refrigerate until firm.
Process onions and ham separately in a food processor. Set aside.
Sauté onion in butter for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden.
Combine ham and onion, then mix in heavy double cream or crème fraiche.
Remove one pastry disc from the freezer. Place on a baking tray covered with parchment paper then spread the filling in an even flat layer.
Sprinkle grated cheese over the filling. Brush edges of the pastry with egg wash.
Place second pastry disc on top and seal edges by pressing slightly with hands.
Use a small glass to create a circle impression in the middle of the tart, leaving about 2 cm around the edges.
Cut the pastry into quarters, then halve each quarter. Twist each piece to create 'sun rays'.
Coat top with egg wash and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 180°C (356 °F).
Bake the tart for up to 30 minutes, until puffed and golden. Serve as an appetizer.

recipes.agent_response: Estimated values for time (45 Mins) and serves (4) based on the provided recipe text.

recipe.title: Coq au Vin
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Coq au Vin: A classic French dish made with chicken cooked in red wine and served with mushrooms, bacon, and pearl onions.

Steps: Filter the marinade through a sieve into a sauce pan and bring the liquid to the boil then reduce the heat.
Carry out the same process with the chicken stock unless you're using a readymade stock, in which case warm it up in a pan and let it simmer gently while you start cooking your chicken.
To cook the chicken, add a mix of butter and oil to a casserole dish and brown the chicken pieces on a medium heat until golden, then transfer to a plate.

In the same casserole dish, cook the vegetables from the marinade for a few minutes before adding the chicken back to the dish. Add a dash of cognac and light it up to 'flambé'. Add the wine marinade and leave to reduce for 10 minutes.

After 10 minutes, top up with the warm chicken stock until it barely covers the chicken pieces and season lightly with salt and pepper. Put a lid on the casserole dish and cook in the oven for 30 minutes at 200 °C or 392 °F.
While the chicken is cooking in the oven, prepare the garnish.

Caramelise the pearl onions: Place the pearl onions into a saucepan and add a tablespoon of butter and half a tablespoon of sugar. Fill with water half-way to the top of the onions and cover with a piece of parchment paper. Leave to simmer on low to medium heat until the water evaporates and the onions are caramelised (they should become light brown in colour). When done keep aside on a plate.

Fried Mushroom and Bacon: Add a tablespoon of butter into a frying pan on high heat and wait until the butters start foaming. Add the mushroom cut in quarters and fry until golden brown. Remove and keep on a plate. Next add the bacon cubes to the same pan and fry until lightly crispy. Then return the mushrooms to the pan, mix well before taking the pan off the heat.

Large croutons: Take a large white bread and cut the crust into triangles. Bring a frying pan to medium-high heat and add a nudge of butter, When the butter starts to foam add the triangles of bread and toast until golden brown on both sides. You may need to add more butter to the pan. When done set aside on a plate.

When the chicken is cooked after 30 minutes, take the meat out of the dish and set aside on a tray while you finish the sauce. Filter the sauce through a sieve and discard the garnish. Once the sauce has been filtered put it back into your pan.

To thicken the sauce, add a small amount of beurre manie (equal amount of butter and flour mix together) until you get the desired consistency. Add the bacon and mushroom and a dash of cognac to the sauce and bring to the boil. As soon as the sauce boils it is ready to serve.
To serve, place the chicken in the pan with the sauce. Add the caramelised onions and croutons on top as a garnish.

recipe.title: Lady Finger Biscuits
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic biscuits with a light and airy texture.

Steps: Separate the egg yolks from the whites and ensure that the whites are at room temperature.

Place the whites into a mixing bowl, add a little sugar and on slow speed beat the whites. After a few minutes increase the speed and gradually add the remainder of the sugar – little by little only once the previous bit starts to foam. Continue beating until all sugar has been added, and about one minute after all the sugar is added bring the highest speed and beat for about 30 seconds more. The meringue should be stiff and shiny.
Using a whisk, beat the yolks to an omelette, and with the beater on low speed, pour them into the meringue. Increase the speed just a little for no more than 10 seconds to incorporate them.
With a rubber spatula continue to fold the meringue until all the egg yolk is incorporated.
Sieve about half of the flour into the meringue and fold it in. Repeat the process with the rest of the flour until it is all well incorporated and the mixture is fluffy.
Pipe the mixture onto baking paper placed on a baking tray – in 10 cm long separate strips. Ensure the individual pieces are uniform in thickness.
Generously sprinkle some of the icing sugar over the biscuits through a sieve.
Heat the oven (fan forced) to 180 °C (356 °F), and whilst the oven is heating, leave the biscuits to absorb the sugar.
Sprinkle the rest of the icing sugar over the biscuits just before you put them in the oven.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the biscuits are a little coloured on top – after 5 minutes reduce the oven temperature to 170 °C (338 °F) to prevent too much browning.
Once cooked, place the biscuits on a cooling rack.
They can be kept for up to 2 weeks in a metal container lined with baking paper.

recipe.title: Braised Lamb Shanks
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: brown lamb stock or beef stock

recipe.description: Tender and flavorful lamb shanks braised in a rich and savory sauce.

Steps: Oil and season the shanks. Brown them well on all sides in a pot with a tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
Reduce heat slightly and sauté the vegetables, bay leaf, rosemary, and tomato paste (add more oil if necessary).
Deglaze with the port wine.
Return the shanks to the pot. Pour the stock over them, making sure it only covers a small portion of the shanks.
Cover the pot and place in an oven preheated to 170 °C (338 °F) fan forced. Cook for 2 ½ – 3 hours or until done.
Keep an eye on the shanks while they are cooking. If the liquid reduces too much, add some stock or water.
Remove the shanks and place them with a little of the sauce on a tray. Cover with foil and keep warm in a slow oven at around 70 °C (158 °F).
Reduce the sauce in a pan and boil over medium to high heat until it thickens – maybe 5-10 minutes.
Sieve the sauce into another pan, ensuring the vegetables are not pureed into the pan.
Bring the sauce back to the boil. Season to taste, add a tablespoon of the port wine, turn off the heat and add the butter. Gradually mix all together until the butter is melted.
Serve on a bed of mashed potato with the sauce generously poured over the shanks.

recipe.title: FIVE FRENCH SPREADS
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A collection of French spreads for various occasions.

Steps: Empty the tuna out of the tin and place it in your food processor bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients and pulse 4-5 times until combined. Serve spread on toasted slices of wholemeal bread.

Cut the ham into pieces and place in the food processor bowl with the crème fraîche and mustard. Pulse 4-5 times until the ingredients are well combined. Try serving with carrot, courgette sticks, and other crudités.
Make the mayonnaise using our classic recipe below. Add the other ingredients and pulse 5-6 times until the sauce reaches the right consistency.
Place all the ingredients in the bowl (except for the chives) and blend for 5 seconds. Scatter with snipped chives just before serving.

Chop the hazelnuts (6-7 pulses) in the bowl and set aside. Wash the fennel, cut it into small pieces, and place it in the bowl. Pulse a few times. Add the lemon juice, goat cheese, oil, herbs, salt, and pepper. Pulse a further 5-6 times. Scatter with the chopped hazelnuts when serving.

recipe.title: Potato Gratin
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy potato gratin with a perfect balance of flavors and textures.

Steps: Hold the potatoes at room temperature for an hour after cooking to allow the cream to set.
Preheat oven to 160˚C (320 F) fan forced.
Wash potato slices in cold water and dry using a tea towel.
In a pot, combine crème fraiche, whipping cream, milk, salt, pepper, bruised garlic cloves, and nutmeg. Add potatoes and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until they can be easily divided with your finger.
Butter a gratin dish, sprinkle chopped garlic slices on the bottom, and season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Start layering potatoes into the gratin dish, repeating seasoning and nutmeg with each layer.
Pour the liquid over the potatoes and cook in the oven for 45-60 minutes or until you can cut through the potatoes with a spoon.
Allow to cool for an hour before eating.

recipe.title: Ratatouille with a Twist
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A twist on the classic ratatouille dish with aubergines, zucchinis, and tomatoes. A flavorful and colorful vegetarian recipe.

Steps: Prepare and cut the ingredients. Cut the aubergine last, just before you're ready to start cooking to avoid it browning.
In a large sauté pan, heat the oil and sear the aubergines for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, then set them aside.
In the same pan, add the onions and celery with a little oil and cook for up to five minutes without too much browning. Set aside.
Sauté the zucchinis with a little salt for 2-3 minutes, then set them aside.

Return the onions, celery, and aubergines (but not the zucchinis yet) back to the pan and mix them together with a wooden spoon. Add the capers, olives, diced tomatoes, sugar, and vinegar and bring to a boil. As soon as it boils, adjust the heat to low and add the garlic.
Moisten the ingredients with a little water and leave to cook over low heat for 40 minutes, partially covered.
When done, gently stir in the sultanas and the zucchinis and cook for a further 15 minutes.
To finish this ratatouille with a twist, top it with pine nuts and serve in bowls with a sprinkle of basil leaves.

recipe.title: Cordon Bleu Two Ways
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Two ways to make the classic Cordon Bleu dish with chicken and ham.

Steps: Flatten the chicken fillets. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Set up the breadcrumb coating by placing breadcrumbs and flour onto separate flat plates or small trays.
Season the chicken fillets with salt and pepper.
Layer a slice of ham and shavings of Gruyère on each fillet, roll them up, trim the edges, and refrigerate again for about 10 minutes.
To bread the escalopes, roll each in flour, then submerge it in the beaten egg, and coat thoroughly with breadcrumbs.
In a frying pan, melt a tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Place the roulades in the pan and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, basting with butter while they cook.
Transfer the roulades to the oven and bake at 160°C (320°F) for around 10 minutes.

recipe.title: Classic French-Style Ragout
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French-Style Ragout: tender beef cooked in a rich and flavorful sauce.

Steps: Season the beef with salt and pepper.
Prepare a mirepoix by cutting the carrot, celery, onion, and bruising the garlic. Keep everything ready to go.
Heat a heavy cast-iron pot over high heat and add oil. Sear the beef in batches until beautifully browned. Set the meat aside.
Toss in the mirepoix and stir quickly for 10 seconds. Sprinkle over the flour and stir well before deglazing with red wine. Let it simmer and reduce slightly for 2-3 minutes.
Add the brown stock, followed by the thyme, bay leaf, cloves, and honey. Nestle the seared meat back into the pot and make sure it's submerged in the flavorful liquid.
Cover and transfer to a preheated oven at 170°C (338°F). Let it cook for 1.5-2 hours, or until the meat falls apart easily.

recipe.title: French Aubergine Caviar
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: French Aubergine Caviar: a delicious and flavorful appetizer made with roasted eggplants, caramelized onions, and tangy tomato sauce.

Steps: Begin by cutting the aubergines in half lengthwise and scoring the cut surface with a crisscross pattern using a knife. Brush each surface with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the aubergine halves to a baking tray with the skin side up.
Preheat the oven to 200°C / 400°F and set it to the grill/broiler function. Place the baking tray on the top shelf of the oven so that the aubergines are close to the heating element.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until the aubergine skin is almost burnt and the flesh is mushy.

Meanwhile, in a medium-sized sauté pan, heat one tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic, season with some salt and pepper, and cook gently over low heat for 10-15 minutes until the onions are translucent.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes, then set aside.

When the aubergines are ready, scrape the flesh into a bowl using a spoon. Mix in the onion and tomato mixture, season with salt and pepper to taste, then finish by adding the mustard, lemon juice, olive oil, and paprika (if using).
Mix well, then refrigerate for at least two hours (overnight is best) to allow the flavors to develop.
To serve, spread the aubergine caviar generously over toasted slices of baguette as an appetizer.

recipe.title: MALTESE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic Maltese dish with chicken, mushrooms, and cheese sauce.

Steps: Melt butter and olive oil over high heat and sauté the chicken to colour both sides, then remove the chicken from the pan leaving behind the cooking juices.
Cook onions in the same pan over medium-high heat for around 10 minutes until brown and set aside.
Thickly slice the mushrooms and cook with the seasoning, sage, and thyme for 5 minutes until the mushrooms are evenly browned.
Return the onions and chicken to the pan along with the port wine. Deglaze over high heat until the juices have evaporated.

To make the bechamel, first melt the butter over medium heat, then add the flour and mix well. Reduce the heat and cook until the roux becomes brown in colour (around 3 minutes). Now add the milk a little at a time, whisking constantly to avoid lumps.
When the sauce becomes smooth, bring to the boil over medium heat and cook for exactly 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour the bechamel into the pan over the ingredients and mix in the cream.
Transfer the ingredients to a baking dish and spread the cheese evenly on top.
Cook in the oven for 20 minutes, then under the broiler (grill) for a further 2 minutes to crisp the cheese. Serve with a side of pasta or salad.

recipe.title: CORSICAN RAGOUT
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A hearty and flavorful Corsican ragout with slow-cooked beef, mushrooms, and pasta.

Steps: Soak the dried mushrooms in boiling water for 30 minutes. Drain them through a fine mesh sieve and reserve the mushroom juice.
Season the beef cubes with salt and pepper. Stuff each cube with garlic and bacon.
Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over high heat. Sear the beef cubes until evenly browned, then transfer to a plate.
Cook the onions in the same pot over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
Return the beef to the pot along with bay leaves, rosemary, mushrooms, passata, white wine, and cinnamon. Simmer partly covered for 30 minutes.
Add the reserved mushroom juice and cognac (if using) to the pot. Raise the heat to high and bring to a light boil, then turn off.
Cover the pot and cook in a preheated oven at 160°C / 320°F for at least 2.5 hours or until the meat is tender.
Add up to a cup of water during cooking if the ragout starts to look dry.
Scoop the cooked beef into a bowl with half of the sauce and reserve the rest of the sauce in the pot.
Cook macaroni until al dente, then drain and add it to the pot with the reserved sauce. Stir gently to coat evenly.
Serve the beef divided into bowls with a side of macaroni and a sprinkle of freshly grated parmesan.

recipe.title: MAC AND CHEESE FRENCH STYLE
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A creamy and comforting French-inspired mac and cheese dish.

Steps: Cook macaroni pasta in a pot of boiling water seasoned with salt.
Pour heavy cream, milk, grated nutmeg, salt, and pepper into a saucepan. Bring to a delicate boil.
Transfer the milk and cream mixture to a bowl and combine with cooked pasta. Toss well.
Coat a baking dish with butter, sprinkle garlic across the bottom, and add macaroni medley. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread grated cheese over the macaroni and top with sliced tomatoes. Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes.
Bake until all flavors meld together.

recipe.title: Beurre Blanc
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A rich and creamy French sauce made with butter, shallots, white wine, and vinegar.

Steps: Prepare and weigh the ingredients. Peel and finely dice the shallot, measure the white wine and vinegar, and cut the butter in small pieces.
In a thick bottom pan over low heat, start by melting a small piece of butter.
When the butter has melted and foaming add the shallots and leave to 'sweat' for a minute until the shallots are translucent.
Add the white wine and vinegar and leave to reduce until you are left with a tablespoon of liquid.

Turn the heat off and add 2 or 3 pieces of butter one at a time while stirring gently with a whisk until the butter starts to melt. When the first pieces of butter have melted, whisk more vigorously and add more butter continuing to whisk.
Now turn the heat back to low and repeat the process of adding more butter and whisking. Ensure the temperature of the sauce does not exceed 65 °C (150 °F) to avoid the sauce failing.
When all the butter has been incorporated, the mixture should be a thick pale yellow sauce.
Season the sauce with salt (if you haven't used salted butter) and a pinch of cayenne pepper.
Finally, pass the sauce through a sieve (chinois) pressing the cooked shallots down to add extra taste to the sauce.
When the sauce is filtered, use it immediately. It's most delicious with poached fish.

recipe.title: Roasted Beet Salad
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Roasted beet salad with hazelnuts, Gorgonzola, and a tangy Barolo Vinegar dressing.

Steps: Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F). Toss the beets with 1 tbsp of olive oil and a pinch of sea salt, then wrap them individually in foil. Roast for about 1 hour, or until a knife slides through easily.
Cool the beets, then peel them by rubbing off the skin with your hands or a paper towel.
Cut the beets into medium slices and place in a small bowl. Drizzle with the red wine vinegar and leave to macerate for 15 minutes at room temperature.

When ready to plate, arrange the beet slices on a serving plate. Scatter the rocket leaves on top, followed by the toasted nuts and crumbled blue cheese. Drizzle with the extra virgin olive oil and season with sea salt and black pepper to taste.

recipe.title: La Bourride
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: dry white wine for the broth

recipe.description: A classic French fish dish with a creamy sauce and crusty bread.

Steps: Make the bouquet garni by laying ingredients on a small square of cheesecloth and tying the top with kitchen twine.
Sauté vegetables in oil without browning. Add fish stock, white wine, bouquet garni, and seasoning. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Make the aioli by whisking together egg yolk, garlic, mustard, salt, and pepper. Slowly pour in olive oil while continuing to whisk until emulsified.
Fry bread slices in butter until golden brown.
Braise fish by adding cream and Noilly Prat to broth. Place fish fillets in broth and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through.
Finish the sauce by bringing it to a boil, then reducing heat and whisking in aioli. Simmer for an additional 3 minutes.
Plate by coating croutons with aioli, laying on serving dish, placing fish fillets on top, and pouring warm sauce over them.

recipe.title: Poulet Au Vinaigre
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: French-inspired chicken dish with a tangy vinaigre sauce.

Steps: Make the white chicken stock (or use good quality stock cubes).
Wash, peel, and cut the onions, shallot, and garlic. Weigh your liquids (wine and cream) and have all other small ingredients ready. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.

Pre-heat the chicken by adding a tablespoon of plain unsalted butter to a large skillet or Dutch oven. As soon as the butter foams, add the chicken pieces skin side first and sauté on each side until they have a light golden color. When done, set aside in a dish and cover.

To prepare the sauce, add the onion, garlic, and shallots to the pan used to cook the chicken and leave to cook on low heat for 2 or 3 minutes. Add the tomato paste and leave to cook for 30 seconds, then raise the heat to high before adding the vinegar. Allow to reduce to a syrupy consistency and then add the wine and leave to boil for 1 or 2 minutes. Add the stock and reduce for 10 minutes.

Reduce the heat to low and add the thyme and tarragon leaves (or sage in the video). Then, add the chicken pieces to the sauce and cook covered for 15-20 minutes depending on the size of your chicken pieces.
When the chicken is cooked, remove it from the pan and set aside in a covered dish to keep warm while you finish the sauce.
To finish the sauce, add the cream to the sauce and leave to reduce for 15 minutes or more. The cream needs to be reduced until it reaches a napping consistency (as shown in the video).
