When the cream is the right consistency, reduce the heat to low, add the chicken pieces back into the pan, cover, and wait until the chicken is warmed up enough to be served.

To serve the poulet au vinaigre, you can simply place the pan on the table and allow everyone to help themselves. Or, to serve on individual plates, remove the chicken pieces from the sauce and pass the sauce through a sieve. Place the chicken on a serving dish and pour the filtered sauce over. That way, you get a smooth sauce without bits of onion, carrot, etc.

recipe.title: French Onion Soup
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: French onion soup with a rich and flavorful broth.

Steps: Prepare your mise en place: wash, peel and cut the vegetables and peel the garlic cloves.
Make the chicken stock (see our recipe for chicken stock on our website).
Filter the stock and leave to reduce for 10 minutes, then turn the heat off.
Cut the garlic cloves in half and remove the germ.
Fill a small saucepan with water and bring to the boil. Plunge the garlic cloves in the boiling water, leave to cook for 3 minutes and remove them from the saucepan.
Press the garlic with fork to create a puree and add to the stock. Reduce the heat to low and leave to simmer for 10 minutes. You can add a few sage leaves to the soup but this is optional.
Make the mayonnaise (see our recipe for chicken stock on our website.).
Add the mayonnaise to the soup and mix gently.
Leave the soup to simmer for a further 10 minutes (avoid boiling the soup).
While the soup is simmering, cut and toast the croutons.
Season the soup and serve.

recipe.title: HAM & BLUE CHEESE TART
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A savory tart with a creamy custard and layers of ham and blue cheese.

Steps: Preheat oven to 180C (356F).
Cut the ham and gorgonzola into small cubes.
Roll out puff pastry and cut a disc large enough for your tart pan. Trim excess and refrigerate until ready.
Combine eggs, yoghurt, and cream in a bowl. Mix well and season with salt and pepper.
Layer hams separately onto the pastry with layers of gorgonzola on top. Finish with custard over ham and cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes at lowest rack with both heating elements on.
Let cool for at least 10 minutes before cutting into slices and serving.

recipe.title: Roasted Lamb
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Roasted lamb with vegetables

Steps: Dice the zucchinis, potatoes and tomatoes into small pieces.
Colour the zucchini, potatoes and tomatoes in a frypan separately in 1 ½ tablespoons of olive oil, pepper and salt each time. Colour by shaking the pan and tossing the vegetables.
Preheat the oven (fan forced) to 210C (410F).

Salt the lamb rack and brown all sides in a Dutch oven, fatty side first. I use sunflower oil for this recipe because the lamb needs to be browned on a medium to high heat and sunflower oil has a high heat point.
After you brown the lamb, remove any excess oil and fat from the pot and then put the lamb back in and arrange the vegetables around. Add the bay leaf, thyme and garlic cloves.
Cover the pot and cook for 20 minutes. Add the black olives 5 minutes before the end of the cooking time.
Once cooked you can serve the meat and vegetables directly in the pot and let people help themselves or plate individually.

recipe.title: Potato Gratin
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and creamy potato dish, perfect for a comforting meal.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 160˚C (320 F) fan forced.
Slice potatoes into 4-5 mm thick slices using a mandoline or food processor.
Wash potato slices in cold water and dry with a tea towel.

In a pot, combine crème fraiche, heavy whipping cream, whole milk, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, and nutmeg. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are cooked through.
Butter a gratin dish and sprinkle chopped garlic, salt, pepper, and nutmeg on the bottom. Layer potato slices in the dish, seasoning with salt, pepper, and nutmeg between layers.
Pour liquid over potatoes and place the dish in the oven. Cook for 45-60 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Allow the gratin to cool for an hour before serving.

recipe.title: Cold Start Roast Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A simple and succulent roast chicken recipe using a cold start method.

Steps: Season the chicken with salt and pepper inside and out and tie the top of the legs together with string for a tidier look. Cut the butter into 4 small pieces.

Spread 2 tablespoons of cooking oil on the bottom of a medium-sized roasting pan and place the chicken in the pan (using a rack if you prefer). Massage the chicken top and legs with the remaining 2 tablespoons of cooking oil. Then, place a piece of butter between each of the legs and wings.

Transfer the roasting pan with the chicken to a cold oven (not preheated). Close the oven door and set the temperature to 200°C (400°F) with the fan force function on. Set a timer for 70 minutes and let the chicken cook without opening the door.

When cooked, transfer the chicken to a cooling rack or plate and wrap the chicken with foil or baking paper. Let it rest for at least 20 minutes before carving. To serve, transfer the delicious jus that has formed at the bottom of the roasting pan into a bowl (you can remove the excess fat from the jus if you like before). Carve the chicken and enjoy the succulence!
Tips: Feel free to experiment by adding stuffing, herbs, or whatever you fancy. If using a larger chicken, reduce the temperature to 190°C (375°F) and extend the cooking time by 10 to 20 minutes.

recipe.title: Quatre Quarts
recipe.creator: Brittany

ingredients.id: Liquor of choice (Grand Marnier, rum, cognac, kirsch, Cointreau, etc.)

recipe.description: A classic French cake with a unique flavor profile.

Steps: Choose how many eggs you wish to use, break them and separate the yolks and whites and place each of them in a separate bowl. Weigh them to ascertain their total weight.
Weigh out the same weight of sugar, flour and butter.
Pre-heat the oven to 200 C (400F) (conventional, not fan forced).
Grease the cake mould.
Melt the butter on a low heat. Once melted, turn off the heat.
Place the egg whites in a bowl, add salt and a squeeze of lemon and beat with a mixer on high speed until the whites are a stiff foam. Reserve in the fridge.

Place the egg yolks and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat on a medium speed until whitish. Still beating, add the butter little by little (waiting until each amount is incorporated before adding the next bit), add the flour in the same way, and then the flavouring.
Slowly stir in the egg whites until fully incorporated.
Pour the mixture into the mould and then cook in the oven for 15 minutes, then reduce the heat to 180C (356F) and cook for a further 25 minutes.
Wait 5 minutes before removing the cake from the mould.

recipe.title: Pottage
recipe.creator: Saint Germain
recipe.description: A classic French soup made with split peas, pork belly, and vegetables.

Steps: Melt a tablespoon of butter in a medium-sized saucepan on a medium heat. Add the chopped pork and fry for 3 mins. Add the carrots, onions and leeks and stir together on medium to low heat. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the peas and mix gently.
Add 1 litre of cold water (if preferred, a stock cube can be added). Raise the heat and bring to the boil. Remove any scum.
Add garlic, bouquet garni and, if the meat came on a bone, add that bone.
Cook gently for ½ an hour and if no salty stock cube or salty meat has been used, then add 12 grams (0.4 oz) of salt.
Cook for a further 10-15 minutes and remove from the heat.
Discard the bouquet garni and bone (if used) and blend the soup with a stick blender to a smooth puree. Pass it through a sieve.
Add 1 tablespoon of butter and melt gently into the soup.
Serve hot with croutons and chopped chervil (or chopped parsley if chervil is not available).

recipe.title: Pommes MONT D'OR
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French dish made with potatoes and cheese

Steps: Mise en place: Wash, peel, and cut the potatoes in half. Separate the egg yolks into a small bowl and beat into an omelette.
Preheat the oven at 200 °C (400°F).

Place the potatoes in a saucepan filled with cold water and 2 tablespoons of salt and bring the water to the boil. When the water boils, cook the potatoes for around 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender but still firm. When done, transfer the potatoes to a colander and leave to drain for a few minutes.
Transfer the potatoes to a baking tray and break them apart with a fork, then leave to dry in the oven for 3 minutes.
Use the vegetable mill to purée the potatoes into a saucepan. Place the saucepan over medium heat for 4-5 minutes to remove any moisture, then season with salt and pepper along with the nutmeg.
Next, add half the butter and mix until it is melted into the potatoes before adding the cheese. When the cheese has melted into the potatoes, add the rest of the butter.
Now turn the heat off and mix in the egg 1 tablespoon at a time to avoid the mixture becoming too runny.
When all the eggs are added, turn the heat back on to low and cook stirring constantly for a few minutes until the consistency of the potato mixture ressembles a dough and stops sticking to the pan.
Scrape the potato mixture into a shallow tray and let sit until lukewarm before packing the potato mixture into a piping bag.

To make classic swirls, pipe walnut size rosettes on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Spoon a tablespoon of melted butter over each and a sprinkle of cheese (optional). Bake at 180 - 200°C for 15 minutes until golden.

To make the potato nests, pipe 2 circles of around 8 cm in diameter, one on top of the other. Spoon a tablespoon of melted butter over each and a sprinkle of cheese (optional). Bake for 15 minutes until golden.

To make the croquettes, place the potato mixture in the freezer until completely cold but not frozen. Roll the mixture into medium size balls, then coat in the flour followed by the egg and finally the breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 180 degrees Celsius for 3-4 minutes.

recipe.title: Cauliflower & Broccoli Bake
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A delicious vegetable bake featuring cauliflower and broccoli in a creamy custard.

Steps: Bring 2 pots of salted water to the boil. Cook the cauliflower florets for 10 minutes and the broccoli florets for 5 minutes.
Preheat a fan forced oven to 210C (410F).
Whisk the cream, eggs, nutmeg and the almond meal together in a bowl and add seasoning.
Butter the inside of a baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drain the vegetables and layer them in the dish, alternating with a layer of cauliflower and broccoli until the dish is full.
Pour the custard over the vegetables and cover with cheese.
Cook the dish in the middle of the oven for 15 minutes and finish for 2 minutes under the broiler (griller) to crisp the cheese.

recipe.title: Cinderella Potatoes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A recipe for perfectly cooked potatoes with a creamy and savory filling.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 200C (400F). Place the potatoes in a roasting pan and cook for 45-60 minutes or until soft when pierced by a knife.
Remove the potato flesh from the skin, taking care not to break it. Set the potato casing aside.
Place the potato flesh into a saucepan with the cream and butter. Mix over low heat until the butter is melted and everything is incorporated.
Flatten the mixture with a fork and season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Turn off the heat and mix well.
Make the savory custard by mixing one tablespoon of cream, ½ an egg yolk, and the cheese together.
Add the chives and parsley to the potato flesh mixture and stir in.
Fill each potato casing with the flesh mixture, using a smallish spoon or piping bag.
Form a furrow along the centre of the flesh and fill it with the custard.

If the flesh is still warm, place the potatoes under a grill for 5 minutes to colour the custard. Otherwise, return them to the oven for 10 minutes at 200C (400F) to warm the flesh and brown the custard.

recipe.title: Beef Stronganoff
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: rump steak or eye filet steaks

recipe.description: A hearty beef dish with sautéed onions and mushrooms in a creamy sauce.

Steps: Saute the onions for about 5 minutes until they are translucent but not coloured. Transfer the onions to a dish and set aside.
Saute the mushrooms for 3-4 minutes without browning them. Return the onions to the pan with the mushrooms and mix them together.
Brown the meat strips, placing them into the pan individually. Be careful not to overcrowd the pan. Brown each side for about 2 minutes.
Return the onions and mushrooms and mix in. Add the cognac (or white wine if preferred) and deglaze the pan.
Add a tablespoon or more of paprika (depending on taste) and salt and pepper and mix in.
Add cream and stir in on low heat and simmer for a few minutes only.
Mix in the parsley and serve with potatoes or rice.

recipes.agent_response: This JSON object represents a Tarte Tatin recipe.

recipe.title: Tarte Tatin
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French dessert made by caramelizing apples and butter in a pan.

Steps: Make the shortcrust dough as per recipe and allow to rest for 30 minutes after refrigeration.
Prepare the apples once the dough has rested. Remove core, peel, and briefly plunge into lemon juice and water.
Make caramel sauce by cooking sugar, butter, and lemon juice in a pan until thick and golden.
Lay apple quarters on top of caramel mixture in the pan.
Roll out shortcrust dough to fit over apples, place in oven at 200°C for 20-25 minutes.
Let tart rest for 10 minutes after baking, then turn upside down onto plate.

recipe.title: Chicken Chasseur
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with chicken cooked in a rich and flavorful sauce.

Steps: Prepare the mushrooms, shallots, parsley, and tarragon. Set aside.
Coat each chicken piece in plain flour, salt, and pepper. Melt butter in a pan. Cook the chicken pieces with the skin-side down. Turn and cook for 25 minutes.
Saute the mushrooms in a pan on medium heat. Add chopped shallots and let them sweat. Flambe with cognac, then deglaze with white wine. Reduce until a tablespoon worth of liquid remains.
Add brown chicken stock and reduce for a few minutes. Take the pan off the heat and stir in butter. Add tarragon and parsley to the sauce. Finally, add the chicken pieces and warm on low heat.
Serve by covering each chicken thigh with warm sauce and sprinkling with freshly chopped parsley and tarragon.

recipe.title: THE CLOUD EGG
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A unique egg dish with cream sauce, meringue, and cheese.

Steps: Mise en place: Measure the ingredients, grate the cheese, and separate the eggs from the whites. Keep the yolks in their shells for later use. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350°F).
To make the cream sauce, pour the cream into a small saucepan with 2 tablespoons of the cheese and some salt and pepper. Mix well and bring the sauce to a boil, then turn off the heat and set aside.

Pour the egg whites into a mixer bowl with a small pinch of salt and a few drops of lemon juice. Beat the whites into firm meringue until stiff peaks form, then add a pinch of black pepper and 2 tablespoons of the cheese. Gently fold the mixture using a spatula.
Spoon 2 tablespoons of cream sauce onto the bottom of a buttered egg dish or ramekin, then place the egg white mixture on top in a mound.
Create a small cavity at the top to later accommodate the egg yolk, then place in the oven and bake for 4 minutes until the egg whites start to color.

When done, remove the dishes from the oven, drop the egg yolks into the cavity on top of the whites, sprinkle with extra cheese, and return to the oven. Continue baking for another 2 minutes, and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Chicken In Tarragon Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French dish with chicken cooked in a creamy tarragon sauce.

Steps: Season the chicken with salt and pepper and dust with flour.
Remove the leaves from the tarragon stalks, wash and set aside. Retain the stalks and tie them together with some string.
Heat the oil in a pot on a medium heat and brown the chicken pieces (skin side first). Brown each side for up to 4-5 minutes and then remove the chicken from the pot and onto a plate.
Add the shallots, carrot and celery to the pot with a little butter (or oil if preferred) and sweat the vegetables on a low heat for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Pour in the cognac and deglaze and then reduce to a syrupy consistency. Add the white wine and reduce again for 3 minutes. Taste to ensure that the acidity has been reduced and if it still tastes too acidic, continue to reduce until this is achieved.

Put the chicken pieces back into the pot and add the stock which should fill the pot halfway up the chicken. Add the tied bunch of tarragon stalks and ensure they are submerged in the stock. Add some black pepper.
Cover the pot and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Remove the chicken breast pieces first leaving the leg pieces to simmer for a further 10 minutes until properly cooked.

Whilst the chicken is simmering, heat the cream in a saucepan and add half of the tarragon leaves. Reduce the cream for about 5 minutes on a low heat, and then strain the cream to remove the tarragon.
Remove the chicken legs from the pot and set aside with the breasts on a tray covered with foil. Discard the tarragon stalks and increase the heat to high for 3-5 minutes to further reduce the stock.
Once reduced, add the strained cream and further reduce on a medium heat until a spoon coating consistency is reached. Stir occasionally to avoid burning at the bottom of the pot.

Chop the remaining tarragon leaves and stir into the stock keeping a small amount aside to garnish the dish. Reduce the heat to low and place the chicken pieces back into the pot and heat for 5 minutes with the sauce. Adjust the seasoning to your liking.
Serve in a large dish, doused with the sauce and a sprinkle of chopped tarragon.

recipe.title: SALMON KOULIBIAC
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Salmon koulibiak is a savory and flavorful dish with salmon fillet, rice, and mushrooms wrapped in buttery pastry.

Steps: Thaw the puff pastry and store in the fridge until needed. Soften the butter for the sauce at room temperature and prepare the egg wash and keep it in the fridge.
Rinse the rice and cook in salted boiling water for 15 minutes. Hard boil the eggs for 9 minutes, then cool in cold water.
Spread the couscous on a plate and sprinkle with salted boiling water—use about 1.5 times the volume of the semolina. Let it absorb the water.

Pat the salmon dry. Bring 1 liter (4 ¼ cups) of water to a boil with the wine, bouquet garni, and poach the salmon in the liquid for 6 minutes. Transfer to a dish filled with half cold water and half cooking liquid. Set aside.

Heat the butter in a frying pan over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and shallots, seasoning with salt and pepper. Sauté until all the liquid has evaporated and stir in the parsley. Set aside to cool.

Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Roll out the puff pastry and cut two rectangles— one slightly larger than the other: 27 x 15 cm (10.5 x 6 inches) for the base and 27 x 20 cm (10.5 x 8 inches) for the top. Chill the pastry sheets on a parchment-lined baking tray in the freezer for 5–10 minutes to firm up.
Peel the eggs and cut them into quarters or slices. Pat the salmon dry, flake it, and reserve it in a small bowl.
Place the smaller pastry sheet on a parchment-lined tray. Layer the fillings in this order, leaving a 5 cm (2-inch) border: rice, flaked salmon, mushroom duxelles, couscous, and eggs.

Fold the edges of the pastry inward to enclose the filling slightly. Place the larger pastry sheet on top, centering it over the filling. Press the edges with the side of your hand to seal, then trim any excess pastry with a sharp knife. Score the edges lightly with the back of a knife for decoration and to ensure a good seal.
Brush the pastry with egg wash and chill in the fridge for 15–20 minutes (or freeze for 5–10 minutes if short on time).

Decorate the top by scoring lines or leaf shapes with the back of a knife, or use leftover pastry for decorative strips. Brush again with egg wash. Bake for 30 minutes, or until golden and puffed. Leave to cool while you prepare the butter sauce.

Combine the softened butter, crushed garlic, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl mixing well. Place a small saucepan over low heat and add the flavored butter to melt it gently. Once melted, transfer to a serving bowl or dish and place it on the table to serve with the Koulibiac.

recipe.title: Le Poulet A Le Biere
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A classic French dish with a rich and malty flavor profile.

Steps: Dutch oven or heatproof casserole dish. Cut the chicken into pieces, then season with salt and pepper and dust with the flour. Reserve the offcuts (carcass) separately on a plate.
Heat the lard or oil for a few minutes, then add the chicken offcuts. Sear the offcuts for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, before removing them from the pot.

Add the chicken pieces to the same pot and sear them evenly until they turn golden-brown, which should take around 4 minutes on each side. Once done, transfer the seared chicken to a tray and discard any excess oil from the pot.

In the same pot, add a small piece of fresh butter and sauté the shallot for a minute or two. Pour in the cognac, and using a wooden spoon, scrape the bottom of the pan to release the caramelized juices. Add half of the mushrooms and bacon and cook for a few minutes to develop the flavors.

Layer the pot by placing the cooked chicken offcuts at the bottom, followed by the chicken pieces with the chicken breasts on top. Season with salt and pepper, and lightly dust the chicken with the flour, ensuring an even coating.

Pour the beer over and mix everything gently. When the foam subsides, add the juniper berries, bay leaves, cloves, and sugar. Cover the pot with a lid and cook in the oven at 160°C / 320°F for 45 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. After 15-20 minutes of cooking, transfer the chicken breasts to a baking tray and cover with foil.

Once the chicken is cooked, take the pot out of the oven, and using a slotted spoon, discard the off-cuts and carcasses. Carefully scoop out the chicken pieces and place them on the tray with the breasts. Next, place the pot over high heat, stir in the cream, and bring the sauce to a boil. Let it reduce for about 5 minutes until it thickens to a spoon-coating consistency.
While the sauce is reducing, broil the chicken pieces in the oven on the top shelf for a few minutes, skin side up, until they become golden and crispy.
Just before serving the chicken, quickly pan-fry the remaining bacon and mushrooms until they turn golden.
To serve, ladle the sauce into a large serving dish, then place the chicken pieces in the sauce. Garnish with the sautéed mushrooms and bacon mixture and sprinkle some fresh parsley on top.

recipe.title: Classic Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic chicken dish with a flavorful jus.

Steps: Pre-season the chicken pieces with salt.
Heat the oil and butter in a pan on medium heat.
Place the chicken pieces into the pan and cook for up to 12 minutes on the first side. Then turn the pieces over (the first side should be well browned).
Add some sprigs of thyme to the pan, and from time to time, baste the chicken pieces with the butter to avoid them drying out.
Continue cooking the chicken pieces until they are cooked through – their core temperature should be at least 70C (165F).
Transfer the chicken to a tray, sprinkle with pepper and cover with foil to keep them warm.

To make the jus, add the shallots to the juices in the pan and cook for 1 minute on medium to high heat. Then pour in the wine and deglaze for another minute before stirring in the lemon juice along with any residual juice from the resting chicken pieces.
Place the chicken pieces into a dish and cover with the jus.
Sprinkle with parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice from the remaining lemon.

recipe.title: Poulet au Vinaigre
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with tender chicken and tangy vinaigre sauce.

Steps: Cut the chicken into 6 to 8 pieces and season each piece with salt and black pepper.
Melt 100 g of butter over medium heat in a sauté pan or Dutch oven. Add the chicken pieces and sear gently for around 5 minutes, until they become a light golden color.
Add thyme and bay leaves, cover with a lid, and transfer the pan or pot to the oven. Let the chicken cook for about 20 minutes, or until it's just about cooked through.

Remove each piece from the pan and place them onto a tray or plate. Pour 3 tablespoons of the cooking juices over the chicken pieces to prevent them from drying out, then cover with foil and keep warm in the oven while you make the sauce.
Reduce the cooking juices left in the pan over medium heat for about 3 minutes. Add all the shallots and cook them in the reduced juices for another 5 minutes.
Add red wine vinegar and reduce it by half, or until the sauce becomes semi-syrupy. Turn off the heat.
Finish the sauce by stirring the remaining 50 g butter into the sauce in small amounts, using a wooden spoon. This process is known as 'monter la sauce' and will thicken the sauce.
Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if needed.

Remove the chicken from the oven and pour any remaining juices into the vinegar sauce. Transfer the chicken to a serving dish, give the sauce a final stir, and pour it over the chicken. Serve hot and enjoy!

recipe.title: Vanilla
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: rum or liquor of your choice

recipe.description: A classic vanilla slice with a creamy filling and flaky pastry.

Steps: Preheat oven to 200 °C (around 400 °F).
Make the pastry cream by heating milk, sugar, and vanilla bean in a saucepan. Whisk together egg yolks and sugar, then add flour and cornstarch.
Add half of the milk to the bowl and whisk until incorporated. Sieve in the remaining milk and whisk again.
Sieve the mixture back into the pan and heat until thickened. Continue heating for 1 ½ minutes after boiling starts. Turn off the heat.
Pour the pastry cream into a cold tray, cover with cling wrap, and refrigerate.
Cut two rectangular pastry shapes and place on a baking tray. Pierce each sheet well with a fork and sprinkle caster sugar finely on top.
Cook in the oven for 15 – 20 minutes until the pastry is golden.
Return the cooled pastry cream to the bowl and add rum or liquor if desired. Whisk in.
Place sufficient pastry cream on one of the cooked pastry sheets and spread evenly over the sheet.
Assemble the vanilla slice by placing the other sheet on top, gently pushing down, and trimming off each side.
Cut the filled pastry into desired widths, sprinkle with icing sugar, and serve.

recipe.title: Braised Ribs
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Slow-cooked short ribs with a rich and flavorful sauce.

Steps: Marinate the meat in madeira wine and herbs for at least one night.
Strain the marinade juices through a sieve, keeping the liquid and garnish separate.
Roll each piece of meat in flour, shaking off any excess.
Sear the meat in lard until browned on all sides, working in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
Transfer the meat to a tray, then quickly rinse and dry the pot and return it to the stove.
Cook the mushrooms, celery, and shallots in butter until lightly colored, then add the leftover marinade garnish and cook for a few more minutes.
Pour in the marinade juice and increase the heat to reduce the liquid by about half.
Arrange the meat over the garnish and pour enough stock to reach halfway up the meat.
Cover the meat with parchment paper and a lid, then slow-cook in the oven for about 3 hours or until the meat easily falls off the bone.
Strain the leftover cooking juices through a sieve, making sure you remove any excess fat produced during cooking.
Sauté the mushrooms and shallots in butter until lightly colored, then pour in the leftover cooking juices from the meat along with the stock.
Dial the heat up high to bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce until the liquid thickens into a semi-syrupy consistency.

recipe.title: Omelette Mère
recipe.creator: Poulard
recipe.description: A classic omelette recipe with a creamy texture and a hint of saltiness.

Steps: Melt the butter over high heat in a thick frying pan.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for a minute to achieve a light colouring on the base of the omelette.
Swirl the pan over the flame to cook the edges of the omelette.
Take the pan off the heat occasionally to ensure the omelette doesn't burn.
After a minute of swirling, take the pan off the heat and allow it to rest for 20 seconds.
Slide the omelette onto a plate and fold one half on top of the other.

recipe.title: DAUBE PROVENCALE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic Provençal dish with tender beef and rich flavors.

Steps: Blend parsley and pureed garlic in a pan. Cover 3 bacon slices on one side with the mix and roll each slice up.
Cut steak into chunky pieces and layer into a bowl. On the first layer sprinkle fresh thyme, place one bay leaf and the 3 bacon rolls and then place the second layer of steak on top of that.
Sprinkle a layer of salt and pepper together with the shallot.
Pour cognac and white wine over with a little olive oil and mix the liquids into the top layer of steak.
Cover and place in the refrigerator for one to two hours to allow to marinate.

Place the meat into a pot or dutch oven, putting the top layer of the marinade in first. On top of that layer, place the bacon rolls, bay leaf and thyme, the orange peel, the onions, the crushed garlic, carrots, tomatoes, olives and if desired, some chopped mushrooms.
Cover with the second layer of steak and pour over a glass of the marinade and stock.
Cover the pot and place into the pre-heated oven for 2.30 – 3 hours, until the meat is ready. During cooking, check from time to time to see if the meat may need turning around.
When the dish is ready, take out of the oven and remove as much of the fat as possible.
I prefer to leave the dish overnight and reheat the next day. This intensifies the flavors. Serve over a bed of hot pasta.

recipe.title: Carbonnade Flamande
recipe.creator: Belgian Chef
recipe.description: A classic Belgian beef stew with caramelized onions and a rich beer-based sauce.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 150 °C (300 °F).
Slice the beef into about 2 cm (½ inch) thicknesses and season them. Thinly slice the onions and finely chop the herbs.
Brown both sides of the meat slices on high heat and in a tablespoon of oil. Do this in stages and without overloading the pan. Transfer the meat to a tray and cover with foil.
Add a nudge of butter to the pan and fry the onion slices for at least 15 minutes, regularly stirring. The onions need to be almost caramelised. Once cooked, set them aside in a bowl.
Return the meat to the pan and cover both sides with the toasted flour by mixing together in the pan.
Now layer the ingredients in the pan. Start by with a layer of half of the meat followed by a layer of onions and a layer of herbs. Repeat the process with the rest of the meat, onions and herbs.

Pour the vinegar over the meat, followed by the sugar, thyme, bay leaf and finish with a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Finally, pour the beer into the pan followed by the meat juices remaining in the tray on which the slices were reserved after browning. Top with water to just about cover the ingredients.
Place the lid on the pan and put it in the oven. Cook for 3 hours until the meat falls apart.
Remove the thyme sprigs and bay leaf and serve with potatoes or pasta and with capers topping the meat. If desired, add some more chopped herbs and more seasoning.

recipe.title: Dauphinois Soup
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy and comforting soup with a mix of vegetables and beans.

Steps: Thinly slice the leeks, onions and carrots and drain the beans.
Warm the olive oil and melt the butter in a stock pot on medium heat until the butter starts to foam.
Stir in the leek, onions and carrot and cook gently for 15 minutes with the lid partly on, stirring occasionally until cooked. Take care not to allow any colouration of the vegetables.
Pour in the stock and mix in the beans and tomatoes. Add salt to taste.
Bring to a simmer and then lower the heat and cook gently for 30 minutes, partly covered. Add a little pepper.
Once done, mix in the cream and parsley (as an alternative to parsley, saute sorrel leaves in butter and place on the bottom of the soup bowl before pouring the soup in).
Cook for a further five minutes and adjust the seasoning.
If desired add some beans to the soup bowl before pouring in the soup.
Enjoy with toasted crusty bread.

recipe.title: Garlic Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A savory and flavorful chicken dish with garlic and cognac.

Steps: Mise en place: Season your chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Dust with flour.

Heat duck fat in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add bay leaf, thyme, and chicken offcuts (if using). Sear for a few minutes. Add garlic to the pan and stir well. Cook for 5 minutes until fragrant. Set aside with chicken offcuts (if using).
Reduce heat to medium and add extra duck fat. When hot, add chicken pieces and sear until golden brown on each side. Add garlic back to the pot.
Pour cognac and wine in the pan and cook covered for 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Pan fry croutons in some duck fat until golden-brown. Reserve on paper towels to drain.
When the chicken is cooked, discard any offcuts, thyme, and bay leaf, plus most of the garlic. Keep the chicken warm, covered, in the oven while you finish the sauce.

Make the sauce by pressing remaining garlic in the pan to extract pulp, then discard sleeves. Add cream and bring to a light boil. Reduce sauce for a few minutes to thicken slightly. Taste and adjust seasoning, then sprinkle with parsley. For a flavor boost, add dash of cognac or white wine.
Serve chicken divided on plates with generous ladleful of the sauce and a crouton on the side.

recipe.title: Grenobloise Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and nutty butter sauce with a hint of citrus and herbs, perfect for serving with poached or pan-fried fish.

Steps: To start, pan-fry the croutons in oil until golden brown, then place them on a plate covered with kitchen paper to absorb the excess oil.

Make the 'beurre noisette' (browned butter). To do so, melt the butter in a sauté or frying pan over medium heat. Keep an eye on it as it starts to sizzle. Once the crackling sounds subside, you'll notice light brown bits at the bottom; this is a sign that the butter is ready and will now have a lovely nutty flavor.
Lower the heat and immediately add the lemon juice to stop the browning process. Then, incorporate the lemon flesh and capers, and thoroughly mix them together. Switch off the heat.
Just before serving, warm the mixture slightly and sprinkle in the parsley and croutons, then serve piping hot.

recipe.title: White Chicken Stock
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic white chicken stock recipe with a rich flavor profile.

Steps: Halve the onion and push 2 cloves into each half.
Slice the carrot into thick slices and do the same with the celery.

Bring the water to a boil in a large pot and put in all of the chicken carcasses and bones. Leave to boil for 2 minutes, then remove from the pot and rinse in a strainer under cold water to clean them.
Discard the water from the pot, clean it, and return the chicken pieces. Pour in enough water to cover them. Place the pot on high heat and bring the water to a boil again.
When the water boils, add the carrot, celery, onions, and bouquet garni to the pot and reduce the heat to low. Leave to simmer with the lid on for 45 minutes.
Turn off the heat and allow the stock to cool for at least an hour to allow the flavors to further infuse.
Remove the chicken pieces and vegetables and filter the stock through a sieve into a container.

recipe.title: CREME AGNES
recipe.creator: Sorel

ingredients.id: home made chicken stock of excellent quality
finely diced leeks (just the white part)

recipe.description: A creamy and flavorful soup with chicken, mushrooms, and leeks.

Steps: Poach a chicken breast in the stock on a low heat for 10-12 minutes. Once cooked, remove it from the stock and keep in the fridge.
Julienne 50 grams of mushrooms – only use white mushrooms, or if they are not available, peel off the coloured skin and discard any other coloured parts (particularly the gills).
Squeeze the lemon juice over the julienne mushrooms.
Melt 50 grams of butter in a pan over a medium-high heat, and once melted, reduce heat to moderate and tip in the julienne mushrooms. Add salt and the water and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and set the mushrooms aside in a bowl containing a little of the chicken stock. Reserve only the cooked mushroom, and none of the cooking juice.
Melt the other 50 grams of butter in a pan on a moderate heat, and once melted, reduce the heat to a simmer and sweat the leek and the remaining mushrooms (previously sliced) for 5 minutes.
Stir in the flour and cook for 3 minutes, then remove it from the heat and allow to cool.
Add the hot stock into the cooled pan a little at a time and (off the heat) mix everything together.
Add salt, return to the heat and bring to the boil, cook for a minute and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Allow it to simmer and reduce for 25-30 minutes.
Pass the liquid into a bowl through a sieve, pressing down on the vegetables to extract as much flavour as possible.

Return the liquid to a pan and on a high heat add the cream and whisk in. Bring to the boil, remove any scum and reduce on a medium heat for 10-15 minutes until a spoon coating consistency is reached.
Serve the soup in a bowl and add the julienned mushrooms and chicken and garnish with chopped parsley.

recipe.title: Almond Cake
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic cake with almond flavor and a hint of cognac.

Steps: Gently whisk together the melted butter, almond flour, crème fraîche, cognac, lemon zest, and sugar until smooth and well-blended.
Add the eggs one at a time, followed by the egg yolks, ensuring each is fully incorporated before adding the next.
Grease a cake pan or porcelain dish, pour in the batter, and smooth the surface for an even finish.
Bake for 40 minutes or until the cake is golden. If you were to insert a skewer into the center it would come out clean.

In the same saucepan used to melt the butter, add 2 tablespoons of caster sugar and 1 teaspoon of water. Over medium heat, reduce to a thick syrup consistency, then turn off the heat and stir in the cognac.
Once baked, lightly dust the cake with powdered sugar just before serving. Serve in portions or directly from the porcelain dish with a side of crème fraîche or thick cream.

recipe.title: Chicken in Cream Bouce
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with chicken cooked in a creamy sauce.

Steps: Dissolve the butter over medium heat in a large cast-iron pot. Add the chicken pieces, followed by the carcass pieces, wings, and vegetable garnish (garlic, shallots, carrot, and the bouquet garni). Leave to cook, stirring from time to time, until the chicken becomes a light golden color.
Add the water and the wine. Leave to cook partially covered for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

When the chicken is cooked, remove the pieces (breast, legs, and thighs) from the pot along with the carrots and shallots and reserve them in a serving dish. Pour a few tablespoons of cooking juices over the chicken and place the serving dish in the oven at 50 degrees Celsius to keep it warm while you make the sauce.
Discard the bouquet garni and add the cream. Boil the sauce for 10 minutes to reduce.
When done, turn off the heat. Mix the egg yolks in a bowl with a little of the warm sauce and pour that mixture back into the sauce. Give it a whisk to bind it.

To finish, take the serving dish out of the oven and filter the sauce through a sieve over the chicken, pressing down with a spoon to extract as much sauce as possible. Serve with pilaf rice or as a side with green beans, garden peas, or sautéed spinach.

recipe.title: Chicken with Morels
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and creamy chicken dish infused with the earthy flavor of morels.

Steps: Drain the morels and squeeze to extract as much of the soaking water as possible.
Wash the morels under water to remove any sand and drain.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
In a frying pan, melt the butter on low heat until it starts to foam.
Add the chicken to the pan and colour lightly for 4 minutes on each side, remove from the pan and set aside on a tray.
In the remaining fat, lightly cook the shallots for between 1 to 2 minutes then add the morels and stir well.
Add the sherry wine and leave to reduce by half. Now add the morel juice and reduce by half again.
To finish, correct the seasoning by adding salt or a chicken stock cube in the pot, then add the cream.
Turn heat up to medium-high to bring the cream to a boil. When it boils leave to reduce for 10 minutes.
Once the sauce has been reduced, place the chicken pieces back into the pan making sure the sauce covers all the chicken pieces.
Lower the heat back to a simmer and cook the chicken for a further 15 minutes (it can be more or less depending on the size of the chicken).

When cooked, you can adjust the taste of the sauce by adding more morel juice or sherry wine. To serve, place the chicken pieces in a serving dish, sprinkle some morels on top and cover with the sauce.

recipe.title: Escoffier Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic chicken dish with a flavorful tomato and chili garnish.

Steps: Season the chicken tenders and lightly dust them with flour. Ditch the flour if you’re gluten free.

In a medium-sized saucepan or sauté pan, heat the oil and add the garlic. Cook for a minute, then add the chili and diced bell pepper. Cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the tomatoes, add seasoning, and cook for a further 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside in a small dish.

In a separate frying pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat and pan-fry the chicken for 10 minutes, turning them over once to brown evenly on both sides. When cooked, transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.
Deglaze the same saucepan with wine and cook for a few minutes to reduce the liquid to roughly one tablespoon, then pour the juice over the chicken.

To serve, you can mix the chicken and garnish together in the frying pan, then serve, or place the chicken neatly on its own onto a dish and spoon the chili tomato garnish over it. For a touch of freshness, add a squeeze of fresh lemon juice.

recipe.title: Poulet à la Briarde
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with juicy chicken and creamy sauce.

Steps: Joint the chicken, saving the offcuts.
Melt butter in a pot, add oil and warm on medium heat. Add chicken offcuts and brown on both sides.
Place jointed chicken pieces into the pan and fry each side for about 5 minutes.
Turn off the heat, remove the chicken pieces and set aside on a plate.
Add shallots and carrots to the pot and sweat them for a few minutes on medium heat.
Add cider and deglaze the pot. Leave the pot on the heat until the stock is reduced.
Return the chicken offcuts and add jointed chicken pieces back, laying them on top of the stock.
Pour the remainder of the cider in and once the stock comes to a boil, reduce the heat to medium low and cover the pot.
Cook on low heat for 15 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts and set aside.
Continue cooking the legs for another 10-15 minutes until cooked. Add to the breasts and keep warm.
Remove and discard the chicken offcuts and (preferably) sieve the sauce and discard the vegetable pieces.
Add cream and reduce to a spoon coating consistency.
Stir in mustard in stages until there is sufficient to taste.
Stir in any juice from the tray containing the warm jointed chicken pieces.
Pour the sauce over the chicken ensuring that some mustard grains settle on each of the chicken pieces. Add sauteed oyster mushrooms to the dish and garnish with parsley.

recipe.title: Espagnole Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French sauce made with brown or veal stock, smoked pork belly, and aromatics. Great to use as a base for any dish.

Steps: Cube the pork belly and cut the onions and the mushrooms into smallish pieces.
Bring the stock to a simmer and skim off any scum.
Meanwhile, place the butter and bacon pieces into a pan and melt the butter. Add the carrot and onion and cook on medium heat until they colour slightly.
Stir in the flour on low heat and leave it to cook until the roux takes on a brownish colour.
Add the tomato paste, stir in and cook for a few minutes to remove the acidity. Leave to cool totally.
Sieve the simmering stock into the pan, whisk in, put the heat on high, and bring to a boil.
If using fresh tomatoes, peel and chop them and add to the pork together with the bouquet garni, mushrooms and the garlic clove (having first halved it and removed the germ). Whisk everything in.
Simmer for 1 ½ to 2 hours with the lid partially on.
Pass the mix through a sieve into another pan, add a nudge of butter, melt it in and season to taste.

recipe.title: CRISPY HAM ROLLS
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy ham roll recipe with crispy cheese topping.

Steps: Cook the milk with thyme, bay leaf, onion, cloves, nutmeg to taste and salt. Add chicken stock cube and stir in. Cook on low for 2 minutes. Turn off the heat.
Melt butter in a pan on low heat. Add flour and mix well. Cook for up to 3 minutes. Leave to cool completely.
Pour hot milk into cold roux, whisking together. Whisk in rest of milk and return to pan on low heat. Bring to boil while whisking.
Add cream and bring back to boil. Add tomato sauce and turn off the heat.
Heat oven to 200°C (392°F). Grease a baking dish with butter.
Pour some sauce into the baking dish, place ham rolls, leave space between each roll. Pour warm sauce over each roll and spread grated cheese on top. Place in oven for 15-20 minutes.
Increase temperature to 220°C if desired for extra crispness. Serve on bed of pasta.

recipe.title: Allumettes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: French-inspired savory snacks with melted cheese and puff pastry.

Steps: Cut the pastry sheets into rectangles. Keep cold in the refrigerator whilst preparing the sauce.
Melt butter in a saucepan. Whisk in flour on low heat for 3 minutes.
Turn off heat and whisk in milk until thickened. Discard whisk and stir in grated cheese.
Stir in egg yolk. Add seasonings to taste.
Cool the sauce so it can be placed into a piping bag.
Remove pastry rectangles from refrigerator and paint edges with water.
Pipe sauce into dry part of each rectangle. Place one or two strips of cheese on top.
Place another pastry rectangle on top, making sure it falls onto the wet part underneath.
Return to refrigerator for 10 minutes.
Trim offcuts from sides and create a vent in the top with a pointed knife.
Brush top with eggwash. Add little shapes of cheese if desired.
Cook in preheated oven at 200C (392 F) for 25 minutes.
Serve as snacks with aperitifs.

recipe.title: Sauce Chien
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and aromatic sauce made with spring onions, habenero chilli pepper, and lime zest, perfect for pairing with grilled fish or meat.

Steps: Chop the garlic and mix into the oil. Let sit to infuse.
Chop the chilli and mix with the spring onion, parsley and lime zest in a bowl.

Juice the limes into a saucepan with the water. Add a pinch of salt and bring the liquid to a simmer on medium heat. Mix the liquid into the bowl with the chilli and other ingredients, season to taste and allow to sit for 5 minutes.
Scoop out the herbs along with 5 tablespoons of the liquid and transfer to a separate bowl and add the garlic infused oil. Leave to macerate for 2 hours before eating.

recipe.title: Apricot Almond Tart
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: fresh apricots or apricots in syrup

recipe.description: Tart made with apricots and almond cream

Steps: Ensure all ingredients are at room temperature.
Place the softened butter in a bowl and mix in all of the sugar with a spatula until the ingredients become creamy.
Incorporate the beaten eggs using a whisk and take care not to over-whisk.
Add the almond meal and whisk in followed by the flour.
Place the mixture in the refrigerator.
Roll out the pastry to cover the sheet. Fold about 1 cm of each side of the pastry inwards to form a sort of parapet.
Pour the almond cream on to the pastry and spread evenly over the pastry (if desired, it can be spread under each fold).
Quarter the apricots and place them in rows on the cream – leave some space between each quarter to allow the cream to cook properly.
Sprinkle sugar on each apricot.
Pre-heat a conventional oven to 190C (354F) and bake the tart for 35 minutes.
To finish, brush the apricot jam and hot water mix over the tart.

recipe.title: TOMATO TIAN
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Roasted tomatoes with rosemary and garlic.

Steps: Season the tomato slices generously with salt and pepper and sprinkle most of the chopped parsley over the top.
Mix the olive oil and crushed garlic together. Drizzle most of the garlic-infused oil evenly over the tomatoes.
Place two sprigs of rosemary on the bottom of the baking dish. Arrange the tomato slices upright in the dish in a decorative way and spoon the remaining garlic-infused oil over the tomatoes.
Garnish with rosemary leaves, the remaining parsley, and a sprinkle of breadcrumbs.
Bake the tomatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned on top.

recipe.title: Ham & Cheese Pithivier
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A French-inspired savory pastry filled with ham, cheese, and bechamel sauce.

Steps: Make the bechamel: Melt butter in a pan on medium heat and stir in flour, then cook for 2 minutes. Add milk and whisk until thickened.
Reduce heat to low, add salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Whisk until boiling, then boil slowly for 2 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Spread sauce on a cold tray and refrigerate.
Preheat oven to 180 °C (356 °F).
Roll out puff pastry to a thickness of about 4mm. Cut out a circle of pastry.
Place smaller piece of pastry on a greased baking tray.
Brush outside edge with egg wash, then place ham, bechamel, and cheese on top.
Repeat process twice, finishing with a layer of cheese.
Firmly press second piece of pastry over filling, sealing edges. Cut away excess pastry.
Indent circumference of pithivier to scallop the edge.
Brush pastry with egg wash and decorate if desired.
Place in pre-heated oven and cook for 30 minutes.

recipe.title: Quiche Cauchoise
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A savory tart filled with caramelized onions and melted butter, perfect for a cozy evening.

Steps: Thinly slice the onions and discard the hard ends.
Preheat the oven to 200C (400F).
Melt the butter in a frypan on high heat. Add the onions, salt, pepper, and sugar. Cook for 20 minutes, stirring regularly, until fully cooked.
Roll out the pastry to about 3mm thick and a little larger than the pie dish.
Roll the pastry into the dish, pierce the base with a fork, and press onto the rim. Put the dish in the fridge for 10 minutes.
Blind bake in the oven for 10 minutes with parchment paper and weights. Remove parchment and weights and bake for an additional 3-4 minutes.
Make the savory custard by whisking together cream, egg, salt, pepper, and nutmeg in a saucepan.
Place the saucepan on medium heat and stir the custard until warm, but not boiling.
Mix the onions into the custard. Place enough meat to your liking on the base of the pastry, then spread the onion mixture across it.
Dot the top with small cubes of butter and bake for 15-20 minutes at 200C heat.

recipe.title: Skillet Soufflé
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and creamy skillet soufflé, perfect for sharing with friends or family.

Steps: Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add flour and stir well. Cook for 2 minutes over low heat, then switch off the heat. Pour a quarter of the cold milk over the hot roux, whisking until you form a thick sauce. Add the remaining milk and whisk again. Return the pan to medium heat and whisk gently until the sauce thickens. Once thickened, lower the heat and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

Add cheese and stir until melted, then turn off the heat. Off the heat, immediately whisk in the egg yolks to transform the béchamel into a mornay sauce. Transfer the sauce to a small bowl and leave it to cool while you prepare the cream sauce and beat the egg whites.
Pour the cream into the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then stir in the grated cheese and turn off the heat. Set aside.
Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt and a drop of lemon juice until stiff peaks form.

In a large, clean bowl, whisk a quarter of the egg whites into the cooled béchamel to create a light, foamy mixture. Then, using a spatula, gently fold in the remaining egg whites, making sure to eliminate any lumps.

Pour the soufflé mixture over the cream in the skillet. Smooth the top with a spatula if needed, then immediately transfer the skillet to the preheated oven. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes, until golden brown on top.
As soon as the soufflé is baked, bring it to the table while it's piping hot, with the cream bubbling underneath. Enjoy shared between two or more people.

recipe.title: Cervelle De Canut
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A classic French cheese spread with a creamy and tangy flavor profile.

Steps: Drain the fresh cheese by placing it in a sieve over a bowl. Leave the cheese in the fridge for 30 minutes. In the meantime, chop the herbs, shallot, garlic, and onions to prepare your mise en place.
Whisk the drained cheese in a large bowl to incorporate some air and make the cheese lighter. Then add the goat cheese (optional) and mix well.
Add the creme fraiche and whisk again for just 10 seconds or so.
Season with salt and pepper and add the vinegar, mixing again.
Finally, add the herbs, garlic, onion, and shallots, and use a wooden spoon to mix all of the ingredients together.
Place the cheese spread in the fridge for 30 minutes to an hour to allow the flavors to infuse with the cheese.
Serve the cervelle de canut with toasted or fresh bread. You can serve it with crunchy vegetables too.

recipe.title: Asparagus
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Asparagus with a rich and creamy Fleurette sauce.

Steps: Begin by adding water to a large pot that can accommodate all the asparagus you intend to cook. Add 12 grams of salt per liter of water, then bring it to a boil.
While the water is heating up, use a vegetable peeler to remove the thick skin from each asparagus.
Once peeled, bundle the asparagus together using butcher's string, then immerse them in the boiling water. Allow the asparagus to cook for up to 20 minutes.
While the asparagus is cooking, create the Sauce Fleurette.
Once the mixture is foamy, add the cold butter and continue to stir vigorously for 2 minutes until the sauce begins to thicken.

As the sauce thickens, ensure that the water beneath your bowl remains close to boiling (as a higher temperature helps with further thickening). Continue stirring the sauce until it achieves a consistency similar to mayonnaise.
When done, remove your pan from the heat and incorporate the salt, pepper, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper. Stir for an additional minute, and your sauce is now ready.

By this point, the asparagus should be close to fully cooked. Once they are, remove them from the water and immediately submerge them in an icy (or very cold water) bath. This step halts the cooking process and preserves their vibrant color.
Now drain the asparagus and place them on a plate or dish lined with either paper towels or a clean white tea towel.
Serve the asparagus with the warm Sauce Fleurette drizzled over it.

recipe.title: Marinated Zucchini
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: apple cider vinegar or tarragon-flavored white wine vinegar

recipe.description: A refreshing side dish made with zucchinis, coriander seeds, lemon, sugar, and vinegar.

Steps: Grate the zest of the whole lemon into a small bowl, then juice the lemon, filter out the pulp, and keep the juice in a separate small bowl. Slightly crush the coriander seeds with the back of a spoon.

Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil and add a few pinches of salt. Meanwhile, use a mandoline to cut the zucchinis into very thin slices. If you don’t have a mandoline, you can use a knife but take care to cut the slices evenly.
Place the zucchini slices in the boiling water and cook for precisely 2 minutes and no more.
Immediately drain the zucchini in a colander and then lay the slices flat on a clean tea towel and gently pat dry.

Take a large serving dish or plate and arrange the zucchini in a rosace pattern so that they overlap (as shown in the video). Sprinkle the crushed coriander seeds, lemon zest, and juice over the zucchinis, then season with salt and pepper. Keep in the fridge while you make the gastrique (sugar and vinegar caramel).

To make the gastrique, place a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the sugar and a tablespoon of water and wait for the sugar to turn slightly amber. When it does, pour in the vinegar and continue cooking until all the sugar has dissolved.
When done, use a spoon to drizzle the caramel evenly over the zucchinis. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours before serving.

recipe.title: Chicken With Chorizo
recipe.creator: Unknown Chef
recipe.description: Juicy chicken cooked with spicy chorizo and served with rice.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 190°C / 375°F (fan forced).
Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Mix the flour and smoked paprika together in a tray and coat each chicken piece lightly in the flour mix.

Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and sear until evenly browned on each side (about 3-5 minutes per side). Transfer the chicken to a plate. Reserve the chicken breasts separately on a plate and cover with foil for now.
In the same pot, add the chopped onion with a tablespoon of oil and cook over low-medium heat for at least 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Pour in half of the Madeira wine and use a wooden spoon to scrape the browned bits off the bottom of the pot to blend with the onions. Add the sliced garlic, bay leaves, and chorizo and cook for a further 10 minutes, stirring regularly.

Reduce the heat to low and add the diced tomatoes. Stir in the remainder of the Madeira wine to take the acidity off the tomatoes. Cook for a minute or so before adding all the chicken pieces, except for the breasts. Stir to coat the chicken in the sauce and add up to half a glass of water about 50 ml if the sauce is on the dry side.
Cover the pot and cook in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Then, add the chicken breasts and turn them in the sauce to coat. Cook for a further 15 minutes, covered.
Serve the chicken divided on plates with spoonfuls of the sauce and rice on the side.

recipe.title: PROVENÇAL BAKED FISH
recipe.creator: unknown
recipe.description: Delicious Provençal baked fish with a flavorful vegetable medley.

Steps: Scale the fish and remove its fins. Ask your fishmonger to prepare it for you if unsure.
Trim 1 cm off the fennel stems, cut off the base of the bulb, and remove outer leaves. Quarter the bulb and slice it thinly.
Preheat oven at 180°C (356°F).
Mix together potatoes, fennel, onions, tomatoes, dried herbs, bay leaf, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add olive oil and mix thoroughly.
Transfer the vegetable mixture into a baking dish, spreading it evenly. Sprinkle garlic on top and pour in water or white wine.
Bake the vegetables at 180°C (356°F) for 40-45 minutes until golden brown.
Score the fish on each side with a small knife. Season the inside with salt and pepper and fill it with fennel, onion, parsley, bay leaf, and lemon slices.
Cover the fish and refrigerate while vegetables are cooking. Once cooked, remove from oven and place the fish on top of vegetables.
Drizzle the fish with olive oil and add a small glass of water. Place back in oven and bake for 30 minutes at 180°C (356°F).
Carefully transfer the fish to a serving dish. Remove skin and gently scoop off flesh, being careful to remove any small bones.
Serve the fish on plates with vegetable garnish.

recipe.title: Baked Pork Chops with Mustard
recipe.creator: Pork Chef
recipe.description: Braised pork chops with caramelized onion and herbs.

Steps: Season the pork chops generously with salt and pepper on both sides, then brush them with Dijon mustard.

In an oven-proof baking dish, place the pork chops and scatter the sliced onion, garlic, thyme, and bay leaves on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Transfer the dish to a preheated oven at 200°C (fan-forced) and bake for 10 minutes.

After 10 minutes, remove the dish from the oven and pour the beer over the chops. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes, depending on the size of the chops, until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve immediately with mashed potatoes, potato gratin, or sautéed potatoes.

recipe.title: Sauce Hachée
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful French-inspired sauce made with butter, onions, shallots, mushrooms, wine vinegar, demi-glace, tomato coulis, capers, gherkins, ham, and parsley.

Steps: Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat then add the onion, shallots and mushrooms. Cook gently on low heat for 5 minutes or until the onions are almost cooked.
When done, add the vinegar, bring to a light boil and reduce for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the demi glace (or reduced stock) and the tomato sauce then bring to a light boil. Reduce on a light boil for 5 minutes or more until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Just before serving add the garnish of capers, gherkins, ham and parsley and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Chicken Bercy
recipe.creator: Bercy

ingredients.id: brown veal or chicken stock or homestyle demi glace

recipe.description: Classic French-inspired dish with chicken cooked in a rich and flavorful sauce.

Steps: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper on both sides. Have the stock or demi-glace ready. Chop the shallots and parsley.

Heat the oil and butter in a frying or sauté pan over medium-high heat. Once the butter starts foaming, add the chicken thighs. Brown each side for about 5 minutes to achieve a nice coloration. Then continue cooking the chicken until thoroughly cooked, turning occasionally. This typically takes about 20 to 25 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken pieces.

While the chicken is cooking, warm up the stock and let it reduce by half to concentrate the flavor. Once reduced, remove it from the heat. Mix the arrowroot with a teaspoon of water in a small bowl, then stir it into the stock to thicken slightly. Set aside.
When the chicken is cooked, transfer it to a plate and cover with foil. Keep it warm in the oven at 50 degrees Celsius while you make the sauce.

To make the sauce, add the diced shallots to the same pan used to cook the chicken and cook them over low heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Once done, raise the heat to high. After a minute, pour the wine into the pan to deglaze. Use a wooden spoon to detach the caramelized juices stuck to the bottom of the pan and let the liquid reduce until about 3 tablespoons of liquid remain.

Once the mixture becomes semi-syrupy, when ready stir in the stock. Once the stock is in, let it reduce for a few minutes until it is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. When ready, turn off the heat, add the butter, and incorporate it into the sauce by swirling the pan.
To serve, place the chicken on a serving dish. Add any leftover cooking juices from the plate into the sauce and mix gently. Pour the sauce over the chicken and garnish with a sprinkle of parsley.

recipe.title: Sweet & Sour Glaze
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A sweet and sour glaze suitable for pulled pork or slow-cooked lamb.

Steps: Pour sugar into a small saucepan and add vinegar and water. Heat over medium heat until the mixture begins to bubble and thicken, stirring occasionally.

recipe.title: Duck Leg Confit
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic dish with fall-off-the-bone tender duck legs, infused with aromatic herbs and a rich, fatty sauce.

Steps: Duck or goose fat

Rock salt, juniper berries, dried thyme, black peppercorns, bay leaves, garlic cloves. Coat the duck legs generously with the herb-salt blend on both sides. Once they're nicely seasoned, wrap each leg in plastic wrap. Now, pop them in the fridge and let them marinate for at least a day.

Grab a pot that can comfortably fit the duck legs flat. Over low heat, toss in the duck or goose fat and let it melt into liquid gold. Keep an eye on the temperature using your thermometer—aiming for around 90 degrees Celsius (200°F). Add in 2 bay leaves, 2 sprigs of thyme, and 3 or 4 garlic cloves.

Lay the duck legs down gently in the pot, making sure they're swimming in that fat. Cover them up with a makeshift parchment lid topped with a smaller pot's lid to ensure they remain submerged in the liquid.
When done, place the cooked duck legs on a plate or tray to let the excess fat drain. Put them under a broiler or into a frying pan for 5 minutes to crisp up the skin.
Mix up some fresh greens and drizzle on a zesty French dressing. That tangy vinegar cuts right through the richness of the confit.

recipe.title: Confit Leg of Lamb
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender and flavorful confit leg of lamb with a sweet and tangy glaze.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C) and season the lamb with salt and pepper.
Sear the lamb in a large Dutch oven or cast-iron pot on all sides over medium heat until crusty and light brown. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Add the carrot, onion, shallot, and garlic to the pot and cook for 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Deglaze the pot with Madeira wine and reduce for 2 minutes. Add the orange juice and reduce for a further 2 minutes to concentrate the flavor.
Return the lamb to the pot and add the beef or chicken stock, rosemary, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring the liquid to a simmer, then remove from the heat.

Cover the pot with parchment paper and the lid. Transfer to the oven. Cook for 6-7 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender and falls apart easily. Every two hours, baste the meat with the cooking juices to avoid the meat drying out.
To make the glaze, mix the orange juice and maple syrup together in a bowl.
Once cooked, transfer the lamb to a cooking tray and brush the meat with the glaze, then place under the grill at 300°F (150°C) temperature for 10 minutes to lightly caramelize the glaze.
Strain the cooking juices through a sieve into a saucepan and reduce over high heat for a few minutes and thicken the sauce with 1 teaspoon of arrowroot or corn starch.
Serve the lamb with the sauce poured over the top.

recipe.title: POULET SAUTÉ ALICE
recipe.creator: ALICE
recipe.description: French-inspired dish with sautéed chicken and mushrooms in a rich creamy sauce.

Steps: Prepare and measure all ingredients. Season the chicken with some salt. Warm up the brown stock in a small pan.

Preheat oven to 70°C / 158°F. Heat butter and 1 tablespoon of oil in a Dutch oven or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieces skin down for 8-10 minutes, then turn and cook for another 8 minutes.
Pan-fry mushrooms with oil, salt, and pepper until slightly colored. Place them in a bowl.

Make the sauce by caramelizing brown bits at the bottom of the pan, adding shallots and mushrooms, cooking for a minute or so. Add wine and cognac, reduce for a few minutes. Pour in chicken stock and reduce again for around 5 minutes. Stir in cream and adjust seasoning with black pepper.
Finish cooking the chicken by placing thighs back in the pot with sauce and cooking for 10 minutes. Add breasts and cook for another 5 minutes. Check sauce consistency, adjusting as needed.
Serve chicken on individual plates or in a dish, covering with sauce. Decorate with sautéed mushrooms and chopped parsley.

recipe.title: Financier Cakes
recipe.creator: French Baker
recipe.description: Delicate French cakes with a caramelized crust and soft interior.

Steps: Measure and weigh ingredients. Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius (392 F).

Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until it melts. Reduce heat and whisk gently until the butter turns hazelnut color (beurre noisette). Filter the butter through a sieve into a bowl and leave to cool.
Mix and sift dry products. Make a well in the middle and pour in egg whites, blending slowly with flour mix. Add butter a little at a time. Rest batter in fridge for 1 hour.
Coat cake mold tray with butter before adding one tablespoon of batter. Add topping of your choice (e.g. pears, strawberries or flaked almonds).
Bake in oven for 5 minutes then reduce heat to 180 degrees Celsius (356 F). Bake for a further 10 minutes.

recipe.title: Grand Marnier Souffle
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French dessert with layers of pastry cream and meringue.

Steps: Add vanilla pod and scraped seeds to milk and warm on medium heat.
While milk is warming, whisk together sugar and egg yolks. Add flour, then milk, and whisk until smooth.
Pass mixture through sieve and cook on low heat, whisking until thickened.
Reserve cream in a clean container and refrigerate.
Melt butter and brush ramekins with it, then sprinkle with sugar.
Soak biscuit slices in Grand Marnier and place in ramekins.
Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F) and cook for 10-12 minutes.
Cool and dust with icing sugar.

recipe.title: PROVENÇALE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Cabbage rolls with pork and vegetable filling, served in a rich tomato sauce.

Steps: Cut off the remaining green outer leaves individually. Keep to one side and save the creamy-white heart.
Blanch the detached leaves after first cutting out and discarding the central hard rib of each leaf.
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a frying pan and fry the sliced onion for about 10 minutes.
Make individual parcels by placing an amount of stuffing onto each blanched cabbage leaf and then roll the leaf. Secure with either a wooden toothpick or string.

recipe.title: Champagne Sabayon
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy dessert made with champagne, sugar, and eggs, served with mixed berries.

Steps: Beat egg yolks with sugar in a large bowl for about a minute, then add champagne and lemon rind and continue to whisk for a further 2 minutes.
Sit the bowl over barely simmering water and whisk constantly until the mixture triples in volume (about 10 minutes).
Remove from heat, place in a tray of ice to stop cooking, and serve with mixed berries.
To serve, layer a dish or cocktail glass with berries and ladle the sabayon over the top. Place under broiler for 1-2 minutes or scorch surface with chef's torch.

recipe.title: Golden Sautéed Potatoes with Bacon, Mushrooms, Olives, and Tarragon
recipe.time: 50 Mins (30 minutes for potatoes, 20 minutes for mushrooms, bacon, and onions)
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and aromatic side dish with golden potatoes, crispy bacon, sautéed mushrooms, and a hint of tarragon.

Steps: Peel and quarter the potatoes. Reserve in cold water. Cut the bacon into lardons (thick matchsticks).
Sear the potatoes until lightly golden, about 12–15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and continue cooking, shaking occasionally, until almost tender—about 20 more minutes.
While the potatoes cook, heat another pan over medium heat. Sauté mushrooms until golden, then remove and set aside.
In the same pan, cook bacon until crisp, followed by onion until softened and lightly caramelized.
Once the potatoes are nearly done, add the bacon, mushrooms, and onions to the pan. Give it a good stir and cook over low heat, partially covered, for another 10 minutes.
Stir in the olives, then toss well. Leave on the heat just long enough for the olives to warm through.
Finish by adding the fresh tarragon, give the pan one last toss, and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Savory Puffs
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.unit: seconds in a food processor for a fine cut

ingredients.id: onions and mushrooms sautéed in butter

recipe.description: Flaky and savory pastry puffs perfect for snacking or as a side dish.

Steps: Combine water, butter, seasoning, and nutmeg. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Remove from heat. Add sifted flour all at once. Stir vigorously until a ball forms.
Cook dough over medium-low heat for 3 minutes to remove excess moisture.
Incorporate beaten eggs. Mix well after each addition. Dough should be smooth and glossy.
Fry choux pastry in hot oil (170°C) for around 5 minutes or until golden brown.
Drain excess oil with a slotted spoon. Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Pink Praline
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A sweet and pink praline treat.

Steps: Roast almonds in the oven at 190C (374F) for 10 minutes.
Heat sugar and water over high heat. Stir in a few drops of red colouring.
When the syrup reaches 124C (255F), turn off the heat and add roasted almonds, stirring to coat.
Pour coated nuts onto silicon mat or parchment paper and collect loose pink sugar into a bowl.
Add fresh sugar so the total mass is back to 100 grams. Repeat steps 2-4.
Coat almonds with syrup again, adding them to a stainless steel bowl and shaking to properly coat.
Bake coated nuts in the oven at 70C (158F) for 30 minutes.

recipe.title: Mouclade
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy mussel dish with a flavorful velouté sauce.

Steps: Melt one portion of the butter in a large pot on a medium–high heat.
Add half the shallots, the parsley stalks, garlic, thyme and bay leaf and cook on a gentle heat for 1 minute.
Add the wine, bring to a strong boil and add the mussels. Use a wooden spoon to mix the wine and flavourings with the mussels for a good minute to ensure everything is well incorporated.
With the lid on, cook the mussels for 4 minutes, every now and again shaking the pot to keep everything mixed in. Take care not to overcook them.
Transfer the mussels to a colander.

Strain the remaining liquid into a bowl, and then using a fine mesh sieve, strain into a measuring jug. Retain 350 ml of the liquid and reserve the rest in case it is needed to adjust the consistency of the velouté sauce.
Stir the saffron into the liquid.
Discard the top shell of each mussel and lay the bottom shell containing the mussel on a plate.
On a medium heat, melt the remaining portion of butter in a pan and once melted stir in the remaining shallots, reducing the heat a little. Stir in the flour and cook on low heat for 2 minutes.

Sift the saffron infused liquid into the roux, raise the heat to medium and whisk everything together and bring to a simmer. Once the simmer starts, cook for at least 5 minutes, stirring regularly until the liquid is reduced to a spoon coating consistency.
Add 2 tablespoons of cream (even more if you prefer) and continue to simmer for a further 10 minutes to further reduce the sauce.
Turn the heat down so that the sauce ceases to boil, mix the egg yolk with a little cream and stir it in. Continue cooking a little longer, still ensuring that the mixture does not boil.
With a squeeze bottle, or a ladle, pour some sauce over each mussel in its shell.
The mussels may now be sprinkled with parsley and enjoyed, or you can place in the oven under the top element and broil for about 3 minutes before serving.

recipe.title: POTAGE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Hearty vegetable soup with carrots, potatoes, and a touch of thyme.

Steps: Melt the butter on low to medium heat and once melted, mix in the onions, thyme, and carrots together with salt and a pinch of sugar.
On low heat and with the lid on, cook for 5 minutes.
Add the cold water and potatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook, lid on, for 15 minutes until the carrots and potatoes are tender.
Whilst simmering, heat the oil and butter in a frypan and cook the bread until golden brown and then drain on a paper towel.
Once the potatoes and carrots are tender, remove the thyme and using a stick blender on medium speed, puree the soup.
Add cream and whisk in to achieve a consistency to your liking.
Filter into another pot through a sieve and melt in a nudge of butter and reheat to the desired temperature.
Pour into bowls, and garnish with the croutons and coriander or chervil leaves.

recipe.title: Lyonnais Sauce
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful French sauce made with butter, onion, wine, vinegar, and demi-glace.

Steps: Melt the butter in a saucier or saucepan over medium heat, add the chopped onion, and cook for 5 to 6 minutes until lightly golden.
Add the wine and vinegar and reduce the liquid by half.
Follow by adding the demi-glace and reduce it to half again (roughly 5 minutes).
Add the cream and continue to reduce the sauce until it reaches a consistency that coats the back of a spoon.
When done, strain the sauce through a fine mesh sieve into another smaller saucepan and adjust the seasoning with some salt and pepper. Finish with a sprinkle of chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Red Wine Butter
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful compound butter infused with the deep flavors of red wine.

Steps: Ensure the butter is soft like a paste.
Reduce sufficient beef stock slowly on a medium heat to yield 2 tablespoons of thick beef glaze.
Thinly dice the shallots and place them into a pan with the bay leaf, thyme and the red wine. Bring to a light boil and reduce it by two thirds.
Once reduced, remove the thyme and bay leaf and transfer the wine to another container and have it cool.
Once cooled, pour the wine over the beef glaze and whisk together until fully incorporated. Adjust the seasoning and whisk in the lemon juice.
Whisk the parsley into the butter and then tablespoon by tablespoon whisk in the red wine.
Whisk slowly at first but once the wine starts to incorporate, whisk vigorously to ensure full integration.

Once all the sauce has been whisked in, scrape the butter onto a piece of plastic film and form it into a log shape and roll the film up around it. Place it into the fridge for at least overnight for full infusion of the flavors.
The butter can be melted over freshly cooked steak.

recipe.title: Pommes Dauphine
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French recipe for crispy fried potato puffs.

Steps: Bring water to a boil and cook potatoes until tender.
Drain potatoes and dry slowly in a preheated oven.
Make choux pastry by boiling water, salt, and butter. Add flour and mix well.
Dry the dough for 2 minutes on low heat.
