Add eggs one at a time to the dough, stirring well after each addition.
Press cooked potatoes into a mash over the bowl with the choux pastry.
Blend the choux pastry and mash together vigorously.
Fry pommes dauphine balls in hot oil (160°C/320°F) until they start to expand.
Drain excess oil from puffs and serve warm alongside a meat dish.

recipe.title: Baked Spiced Courgettes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Baked courgettes with a spicy and aromatic flavor profile, served with a crunchy onion crumble.

Steps: Trim the ends of the courgettes and slice them lengthwise into halves then quarters.
Transfer the sliced courgettes to a large dish.
In a small bowl, mix the onion and garlic, then add the spices and season with salt and pepper.
Finish by adding the olive oil, and water, and mix well. Let the mixture sit for 3 minutes to allow the flavors to combine.
Pour half of the spiced mixture over the courgettes in the dish.
Use your hands to coat the courgettes evenly with the mixture.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Transfer the courgettes to a large roasting tray, leaving space between each one.
Spoon a few more spoonfuls of the spiced mixture over the courgettes.
Cover the tray with parchment paper and bake in the oven for 15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, remove the parchment paper and spoon the remaining spiced mixture evenly over the courgettes.
Return the tray to the oven and bake for a further 15 minutes or more until the courgette's edges are lightly browned and the onion mixture is partly caramelized.
When cooked, transfer the courgettes to a serving dish and let them sit while you make the onion crumble.

In a medium-sized frying pan, combine the reserved spiced onion mixture with the breadcrumbs and cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until the breadcrumbs become golden brown.
Serve the courgettes with a drizzle of lemon juice, a sprinkle of parsley, and plenty of onion crumble.

recipe.title: Raspberry & Fig Tart
recipe.creator: Unknown (Anonymous)
recipe.description: A sweet and savory tart featuring fresh figs and raspberries.

Steps: Preheat the oven to 180C (360F) (fan forced) and ensure that both top and bottom elements are on.
Roll out the pastry, take a tart tin and line the tart tin with the pastry.
Spread the almond cream in a thin layer over the base of the tart.
Quarter the figs lengthwise and arrange them to cover the almond cream.
Bake the tart in the oven for 40 minutes with the tart sitting closer to the bottom of the oven so that the base of the pastry cooks properly.
Sprinkle the cinnamon over the figs.
Randomly place the raspberries on top of the figs, together with a few slices of fresh figs. Wait for the tart to cool before eating.

recipe.title: GRILLED MARNATED AUBERGINE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Grilled and marinated aubergine with a sweet and tangy flavor profile.

Steps: Remove the ends of the aubergines and cut them in half lengthwise. Brush both sides with olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper.
Preheat a grill pan, preferably cast iron, over high heat.
Brush the grill pan with a little olive oil and place the aubergine halves on the pan, skin side down. Grill for about 5 minutes or until lightly charred and tender.
Flip the aubergine halves over and grill for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove the aubergines from the pan and let them cool for a few minutes. Then, cut them into 1 cm pieces using kitchen scissors, into a mixing bowl.
In a separate small mixing bowl, combine the vinegar, sugar, cloves, raisins, cashews, lemon juice, and olive oil. Whisk until the sugar dissolves and the ingredients are well combined.
Add the bay leaves, lemon zest, and chili flakes to the aubergines. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the marinade over the aubergines and use a spoon to gently mix the ingredients together, making sure the aubergines are well coated in the marinade.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve with slices of toasted baguette.

recipe.title: RED TAPENADE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic Provençal dip with sun-dried tomatoes, green olives, and capers.

Steps: Roughly chop the sun-dried tomatoes before processing.
Crush the garlic cloves with a garlic press.
Measure the other ingredients.
Process the mixture for 10 to 20 seconds.

recipe.title: Rice Pudding
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A creamy and comforting rice pudding recipe.

Steps: Place a large saucepan over medium heat and pour the milk in followed by the sugar and the vanilla bean. Leave to warm up gently.

Fill a separate medium size saucepan with water and bring the water to the boil. When the water boils, rinse the rice under cold water in a wire mesh sieve and then plunge the rice into the boiling water and leave it to cook (blanch) for 2 minutes. After 2 minutes, strain the rice through the sieve and add it to the warm milk. Stir gently.

Now turn the heat to low and allow the rice in milk mixture to simmer gently (partly covered with a lid) for 35 to 40 minutes. Stir the mixture from time to time to prevent any of the rice sticking to the bottom of the saucepan.
After 40 minutes, turn the heat off and add the cold butter plus a pinch of salt to the rice. Stir gently with a wooden spoon until the butter is incorporated.
Now add the two egg yolks to the rice and keep stirring gently until the rice pudding develops a 'pale yellow' custard color. This usually takes less than a minute.

Once the egg yolks are fully incorporated, spoon the rice pudding into a large baking tray or dish and remove the vanilla pod. Level the top with a spoon or spatula and then cover with cling film that sits directly in contact with the rice.
Place the rice pudding in the fridge and let it cool for between one and two hours to allow the vanilla flavor to develop fully.
This rice pudding recipe tastes best served fridge cold.

recipe.title: Cabbage Soup
recipe.creator: French Chef

ingredients.unit: slices (oven toasted and cut in chunks)

recipe.description: A hearty French soup made with tender cabbage, smoky pork belly, and a hint of butter.

Steps: Tear off the outer leaves of the cabbage until you are left with the core. Rinse the cabbage under cold running water.
Cut the cabbage in 4 quarters and trim off the base of the stem.
Slice the smoked pork belly in squares or rectangles of around 1 cm (half an inch) thick.
Cut the carrot in a rough 'mirepoix' (medium size cubes or chunks).
Cut the onion in half and prick 3 cloves on one half and cut the other in 2 quarters.

Place the cabbage quarters in a stock pot filled with cold water with 2 pinches of rock salt. Bring to the boil and as soon as the water starts to boil, turn the heat off and rinse the cabbage under running cold water.
Remove the hard part of the stem of each cabbage quarter (as shown in the video). Then roughly slice each quarter and set aside.

Place a stock pot on the stove on medium heat. Add the butter and let it melt. Next, add the carrot and the 2 quarters of onion and leave to sweat for 20 to 30 seconds. Add half of the cabbage, mix well and leave to cook for 2 minutes. After 2 minutes add the pork belly slices along with the other onion half with the cloves. Add the rest of the cabbage on top and leave as is. Don't mix this second layer of cabbage with the rest of the ingredients.

Add the chicken stock and cover the stock pot with a lid leaving a small opening to allow for steam release. Cook for 1h 30 minutes. You can cook the soup for a slightly shorter time if you like your cabbage to have a bite to it.
When the soup is ready, slice and toast some sourdough bread to serve with the soup.
Grate some cheese over the soup just before serving.

recipe.title: CLASSIC EGG SALAD
recipe.creator: Egg Salad Expert

ingredients.id: white wine or apple cider vinegar

recipe.description: A classic egg salad recipe with a creamy dressing and a hint of curry powder.

Steps: Egg preparation: Bring a pot of water to a boil, then gently place the eggs in the boiling water and cook for exactly 8 minutes. Once done, drain the hot water and fill the pan with cold water to stop the cooking process. Let cold tap water run over the eggs for a minute to ensure they cool down. Leave the eggs in the cold water for 5 minutes before peeling them.

Make mayonnaise: Whisk together the egg yolk, mustard, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Whisk vigorously for about 20 seconds. Slowly add the oil, one tablespoon at a time, whisking thoroughly after each addition. Once the oil is incorporated, stir in a few drops of white wine. Transfer the mayonnaise to a clean bowl, cover, and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes.

Mix egg salad: Once the eggs are peeled, chop them into small pieces. Place the chopped eggs in a bowl, add 5 tablespoons of the mayonnaise, and gently mix with a fork or spatula. Stir in the chopped chives. For the best flavor, let the egg salad chill in the fridge for 10-15 minutes before serving.
Optional variations: Add boiled potatoes, finely diced fresh tomatoes, a small can of drained tuna, and a hint of Tabasco sauce for a kick.

recipe.title: CORSICAN RABBIT
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender and flavorful rabbit dish with a rich Corsican-inspired sauce.

Steps: Cut the rabbit into 4 to 6 pieces. Cut the pancetta into lardons. Finely slice the onion.
Measure and weigh the rest of the ingredients.
Heat the olive oil in a casserole dish over medium heat, then add the rabbit pieces and lightly brown them on each side for 5 to 6 minutes.
Once browned, remove the rabbit pieces and set them aside on a plate.
Add the pancetta lardons to the casserole, stir, and cook for 2 minutes until lightly colored.
Then, add the sliced onions and garlic to the pot. Adjust the heat to low and continue to cook the onions and pancetta for 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the vinegar and white wine, mix well, then add the tomato paste, olives, capers, and herbs. Stir thoroughly, then return the rabbit pieces to the casserole.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and let cook on low heat at least 1 hour until tender, stirring occasionally.

recipe.title: Perfect French Crêpes
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French breakfast or snack with delicate and flavorful crêpes.

Steps: Mix flour, salt, and sugar together in a large bowl.
Make a well in the centre of the mixture and add eggs.
To prevent clumps, whisk in 1 cup of milk and then another cup until smooth.
Cover the batter and let it rest for at least an hour.
Stir in remaining milk and pass through a sieve to ensure lump-free.
Melt butter and whisk into batter with liquor (if using).
Heat a crêpe pan over high heat, coat with oil, and plant potato fork.
Use 3 tbsp of batter per crêpe, spread evenly, and cook for 40 seconds each side.
Repeat until all batter is used. Serve with your favorite toppings.

recipe.title: Palmiers
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Crispy and golden palmiers snacks with a delicious pesto flavor.

Steps: Ensure the pastry is defrosted but still cold enough to roll easily.
Lay the puff pastry sheet flat on a piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap.
Spread half of the pastry sheet with red pesto and the other half with green pesto.
Roll both sides of the pastry tightly towards the middle until the rolls touch each other.
Cover the pastry roll with plastic wrap and place it in the freezer for about 10 minutes to firm up.
After the pastry has firmed up, use a large knife to cut the roll into slices, each about 1 cm thick.
Arrange the slices on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Put the tray back in the fridge while you preheat your oven to 200 C (400 F).
Once the oven has reached the desired temperature, place the tray inside and loosely cover it with a piece of aluminum foil.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, depending on the size of the slices, until they are golden and crispy. Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Strawberries with Balsamic Glaze & Mascarpone Crème
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: IGP balsamic vinegar (for IGP balsamic reduction)

recipe.description: A simple yet elegant dessert featuring sweet strawberries with a tangy balsamic glaze and creamy mascarpone crème.

Steps: Toss the strawberries with balsamic, strawberry purée, sugar, lemon juice, and pepper. Let them sit for about 15 minutes to soften and absorb all those lovely flavors.

In a small saucepan, gently heat the balsamic, honey, and red wine or port. Let it simmer over low heat for 5–7 minutes until it thickens slightly. Remove from the heat and whisk in the butter to smooth out the acidity. Set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the mascarpone, double cream, icing sugar, vanilla seeds, and fleur de sel until smooth and luscious. Keep chilled until ready to serve.

To serve, arrange the balsamic strawberries in a glass or on a small plate and spoon a quenelle of vanilla mascarpone beside them. Drizzle over the balsamic reduction in delicate swirls. Finish with the almond tuile for texture and height or sprinkle with biscuit crumbs. For an extra flourish, garnish with chopped basil and edible flowers (optional).

recipe.title: Lamb
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and aromatic lamb dish with a rich brown stock.

Steps: Brown the diced lamb in batches on high heat for 3-4 minutes per side.
Deglaze the pan with white wine, adding shallots and reducing the wine slowly.
Bring the brown stock to a boil, whisking in beurre manie to thicken.
Add the lamb, tomato paste, and herbs to the deglazed pan. Stir well.
Simmer the mixture for 15-30 minutes or until the lamb is cooked.
Saute the mushrooms and add them to the simmering lamb, along with crushed garlic.
About 5 minutes before serving, mix in tarragon, parsley, and chervil (if using).
Add cognac and stir well. Serve with potatoes or rice.

recipe.title: CHEESY PORK CHOPS
recipe.creator: Unknown

ingredients.id: crème fraiche or thick cream (heavy cream)

recipe.description: A flavorful and cheesy pork chops recipe with a crispy broiler-glazed topping.

Steps: Remove pork chops from the fridge at least 15 minutes before cooking. Remove the skin, coat with salt and brush both sides with oil.

Heat a pan on medium heat and start cooking the chops once the pan is hot. Cook for at least 10-12 minutes until the core temperature of the meat reaches 65C (150F). Once cooked, transfer the chops to a plate.
Now, turn your oven broiler (griller) on so that it's hot when you're ready to broil the chops.
Whisk the cream, mustard and cheese together in a bowl.
Generously coat one side of the chops with the mixture and sprinkle black pepper on top and more cheese if you like.
BYILL (grill) the chops close to the top of the oven for 5 minutes until the cheese is light brown and crisp but be careful not to burn the cheese.

recipe.title: Almond Cream Tart
recipe.creator: French Pastry Chef
recipe.description: A classic French dessert featuring almond cream and poached pears.

Steps: Prepare a tart base and heat oven to 200 °C (396 °F).
Bring butter and eggs to room temperature.
Whisk the butter in a bowl until a soft consistency.
Add the icing sugar and continue whisking until the mixture is creamy.
Add the eggs and again whisk vigorously until well emulsified.
Add the almond meal, vanilla essence and almond essence and whisk again then add flour and whisk in.
Pipe the cream into the tart base.
Place pear halves (if using fresh pears, first poach them in syrup) on top of the cream and press down well.
Bake in the oven for 20-40 minutes until cooked.
Glaze the top of the tart with maple syrup.

recipe.title: Madeleines
recipe.creator: French Baker
recipe.description: Delicate French cakes with a subtle lemon flavor.

Steps: Break the eggs in a large bowl. Pour in the sugar and whisk slowly for 1 minute.
Add the honey and continue to whisk for a further 3 minutes (until the mix becomes white and foamy).
Now melt the butter in a small saucepan on a medium heat. When the butter has melted add a squeeze of lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Remove the saucepan from the heat and allow the butter to cool.
Sift the flour and baking powder into your bowl over the egg and sugar mixture and whisk gently until the flour is fully incorporated.
Pour in the melted butter and whisk again until you have a smooth batter.
Leave the batter to rest for at least 2 hours at room temperature.
Coat your madeleine pan with melted butter and add a generous spoon of batter to each mold. Leave a little space free to allow each madeleine to grow when baked.
Cook the madeleines for 10 minutes starting on high heat at 220 °C (428 °F) for the first 3 minutes then reduce the heat to 200 °C (392 °F) and bake for a further 6 to 7 minutes.
Remove the madeleines from the oven and leave to cool for a few minutes. Remove from the mold and enjoy while still warm.

recipe.title: ESCOFFIER BROWN STOCK
recipe.creator: Unknown Chef
recipe.description: Brown stock recipe from Escoffier

Steps: Roast the bones and meat in a hot oven until dark brown.
Make a bouquet garni with parsley, thyme, and bay leaves.
Add carrots and onions to the roasting pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove excess fat from the roasted bones and vegetables.
Transfer the bones and vegetables into a large stockpot and add water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5-6 hours.
Cut meat into large dices and sear in oil until light brown.
Deglaze with bone broth and simmer for approximately 2 hours.
Pass the stock through a fine mesh sieve and refrigerate overnight.

recipe.title: Chocolat Liégeois
recipe.creator: French Pastry Chef
recipe.description: A rich and creamy French dessert made with chocolate custard, whipped cream, and toppings.

Steps: Measure all the ingredients. Separate the egg whites from the yolks.
Break the chocolate bar into small pieces and place them in a large bowl.

To make the custard, pour the milk and cream into a saucepan. Split the vanilla bean in half, scrape the seeds, and add both the husk and seeds to the milk and cream mixture. Turn the heat to medium and warm until just before boiling.
Whisk the egg yolks and sugar in a large bowl for a minute until the mixture thickens slightly and becomes a bit pale.

Once the milk and cream are hot enough, turn off the heat and pour half of the mixture through a sieve over the egg and sugar mixture. Stir gently to combine, then add the rest of the milk mixture and stir again.
Transfer the custard back into the pan you used to warm the milk. Turn the heat to medium and cook the mixture, stirring constantly, until it reaches 80°C (176°F).
To turn the custard into the chocolate dessert, pour half of the custard over the chocolate and mix well with a spatula to combine.
Then add the rest of the custard and continue stirring until you get a smooth chocolate cream.
Pour the cream into a clean bowl, cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
Once the chocolate custard is completely chilled, pour it into glasses or cups. Whip the cream with the sugar, then transfer it to a piping bag.
Add a generous swirl of whipped cream over the chocolate, add some toppings, and serve immediately.

recipe.title: Chicken & Reisling
recipe.creator: German Chef
recipe.description: A rich and flavorful German-inspired dish featuring chicken, mushrooms, and a hint of wine.

Steps: Saute the mushrooms in oil until they are just coloured. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Colour the chicken in oil on high heat on both sides for 1 minute on each side until they become a blonde colour, then remove from the pot.
Reduce the heat and sauté the shallots, garlic, and thyme in the oil remaining from colouring the chicken. Cook for around 3 minutes.
Turn the heat to high, add the cognac and deglaze the pan until the cognac is nearly all evaporated.
Add the mushrooms and chicken back into the pan and pour the chicken stock (preferably made from the chicken off-cuts) and the riesling and bring to the boil. Simmer partly covered for 15 minutes.

Remove the chicken breasts first and keep warm in the oven at 60°C (140℉) and continue cooking the legs for a further 15 minutes. Then transfer the chicken legs to keep warm in the oven with the breasts.
Increase the heat to high and boil the remaining sauce for about 4-5 minutes to concentrate the flavours.
Stir in the cream and continue to reduce the sauce on a medium heat for 5 minutes. The sauce is ready when it reaches a spoon-coating consistency.
Turn off the heat, return the chicken pieces to the pan and coat them with the sauce.

recipe.title: Bastille Crêpes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Delicious French crêpes with a sweet and tangy topping.

Steps: Combine flour, salt, and sugar in a large bowl. Whisk together before making a well.
Break eggs into the well. Add half of the milk and whisk until smooth. Then, add the rest of the milk and whisk again.
Cover the bowl with a clean tea towel and let the batter rest for at least 1 hour.
After resting, whisk in a tablespoon of liquor (optional).
Cook crêpes using a potato brush to coat the pan. Use just enough batter to cover the bottom of the pan.
Cook first side for 30 seconds, flip, and cook second side for 15 seconds. Repeat until all batter is gone.
Serve with blueberries, raspberry coulis, and whipped cream.

recipe.title: ANTIBOISE
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: ANTIBOISE sauce for dipping or on toast / fried croutons brushed with garlic and a drizzle of dressing on top.

Steps: Peel the tomatoes, remove their seeds and roughly chop them. Remove as much juice as possible with a paper towel.
Grind the pepper and salt into the base of a salad bowl and pour in the vinegars. Mix until the salt has dissolved and then pour in the olive oil.
Add the capers and chopped tomato and mix in before adding the garlic and spring onion and mixing again. Do the same with the coriander.
Thinly slice about half the basil leaves and add along with the remaining whole basil leaves, mixing in with the sauce.
Let the mixture stand, covered, in the bowl for 15 minutes to marinate. Remove the whole basil leaves and drain most of the liquid out of the mixture. Add lemon zest if desired.
Serve in a bowl for dipping or on toast / fried croutons brushed with garlic and a drizzle of dressing on top.

recipe.title: FAR BRETON
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French dessert with prunes and a hint of rum.

Steps: Soak the prunes in the alcohol (or you can use water or tea).
Preheat the oven (fan forced) to 180C (300F).
Melt the butter in a pan on a medium heat until it starts to foam and releases a chestnutty aroma. Turn off the heat.
Sieve the flour into a bowl and add the sugar and vanilla seeds. Whisk so everything is mixed and then create a well in the middle.
Whisk the eggs one by one into the well, adding another egg each time the mix becomes stiff.

Once the eggs and flour are fully incorporated and a smooth consistency is obtained, add and whisk in the milk a little at a time (around a third at a time) and mix until each third is well incorporated. Then add the rum and whisk in.
Add the melted butter (cooled a little) and whisk in.
Place the pitted prunes on the base of a baking dish and pour the batter over slowly so the prunes don’t move. Ensure the prunes are well covered.
Cook in the oven for 25 minutes – 40 minutes depending on the amount of batter in the dish. It is ready when the top turns a deep brown.
You can enjoy this dessert lukewarm or at room temperature.

recipe.title: Beef Ragout
recipe.creator: Vegetarian Chef
recipe.description: This beef ragout is a modern French twist on osso bucco, braised traditionally with stock, wine, honey, orange peels, cloves, and tomatoes for a tangy flavor.

Steps: Season the meat with salt and pepper, then lightly dust each side with flour.
Heat oil in a pot and brown the meat on each side. Be careful not to overcrowd the meat.
Reduce heat to low, add garlic, carrot, onions, and turnips (or parsnips) into the pot. Sweat the vegetables for 2-3 minutes.
Add tomato paste and mix well, then pour in red wine and deglaze the pot. Simmer for a few minutes to reduce the liquid.
Pour in brown veal or beef stock, bring to a simmer, and add thyme, cloves, orange peel, and honey. Stir well and return to a simmer.
Gently place the meat back into the pot. Simmer with the lid on for 2-2.5 hours, or longer if necessary.
Serve with your favorite pasta, rice, potatoes, and some bread.

recipe.title: Creamy Chicken Soup
recipe.creator: Stephane
recipe.description: Hearty and flavorful chicken soup with a creamy twist.

Steps: Joint the chicken but save the breasts for garnishing the soup or for using in another recipe. Thinly slice the onion and slice the leeks, celery, carrots and shallots.
On medium or high heat melt the butter and add all the vegetables and herbs (except parsley). Reduce the heat to medium and sweat the vegetables and herbs for 3-4 minutes.
Add the chicken (leave out the carcass) and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the salt, pepper and cumin seeds and mix in.
Add the water – enough to just cover the chicken and vegetables. Add the carcass and the parsley (including the stalks).
Bring the contents to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer for an hour, preferably with the lid off. At this point, the meat should be falling off the bone.
Remove the carcass, any scum, and the bay leaf, thyme and parsley and discard them for compost.
Remove the drumsticks and other meaty bits of chicken and set aside. Use a stick blender to blitz the vegetables and then remove any foam.
Add the cream and mix in, then gently bring the soup back to a simmer.

To serve, shred the chicken meat and add it back to the soup along with a few more cumin seeds. My other serving suggestion is to place sliced carrot in a bowl, pour the soup, then add the shredded chicken, chopped parsley and croutons.

recipe.title: Fish Quenelles
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Fish quenelles with a creamy sauce and poached crustaceans.

Steps: Half freeze the fish fillet. Scoop mixture to form a quenelle shape and place into simmering water.
Poach for 5 minutes, then turn over and repeat after another 5 minutes.
Poach for a further 5 minutes, then remove from water and drain on paper towel.
Melt butter in saute pan on high heat. Colour scampi shells. Add carrot, garlic, shallots, celery, leeks and mix in.
Reduce heat to medium and cook for about 2 minutes. Add cognac and burn off fumes. Mix again.
Add cream and reduce heat to minimum. Taste and correct seasoning if necessary.
Pass sauce through sieve into fish stock. Reduce to spoon coating consistency.
Heat oven to 190 °C (374 °F). Place quenelles in ovenproof dish with scampi tails and sauce.
Cook for 10 minutes, then serve.

recipe.title: Seafood à l'Armoricaine
recipe.creator: French Chef

ingredients.id: firm white fish (monkfish, cod or similar)

recipe.description: Delicious Seafood à l'Armoricaine with a medley of seafood, creamy sauce and fresh flavors.

Steps: Wash and scrub the mussels to remove any grit stuck to the shells. Cut off the hairlike seaweed protruding from the clasp of the mussel, known as the beard.
Cook for 2 minutes in the remaining crab cooking juices. Deglaze the pan with the wine and allow the liquid to reduce until the ingredients are almost dry.
Stir in the tomato puree, ensuring it is well combined with the other ingredients.
Add the bay leaves, thyme, and garlic, mixing them thoroughly before adding the tomatoes.
Let the mixture cook for 2 minutes.
Return the cooked crab to the sauce, season with salt and pepper, and allow it to simmer covered for 10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
When done, remove the main pieces of crab from the sauce and set them aside on a plate. Pass the sauce through a sieve into a container to remove any solids, then return the sauce to the pan.
Place it over medium-low heat and stir in the cream, followed by the Espelette pepper and white vermouth. Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer.
When ready, add the mussels to the sauce and cook for about 6 minutes until they open up.
Once done, remove the mussels from the sauce and reduce the heat to low.
Now add the fish to the sauce, cooking gently for about 5 minutes until the fish is half cooked.
Then, return the mussels and crab to the sauce and leave to cook covered for a further 5 to 10 minutes until the fish is cooked through.

recipe.title: Ham & Cheese Croquettes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A thick bechamel sauce used for ham and cheese croquettes, served with deep fried parsley.

Steps: Make the béchamel: melt butter on a low to medium heat.
Add flour, mix in and cook for 3 minutes. Turn off heat and allow to cool.
With the heat off, pour milk into a saucepan and add bayleaf, thyme, cloved onion, quartered mushrooms and pepper and salt, turn heat on to medium and bring milk slowly to the boil.
Grate cheese and cut the ham (it can be shredded in a food processor).

When boiled, pour some milk into the cold roux through a sieve and whisk to incorporate, and it is, add the remaining milk and whisk in. Then bring the heat back on (to medium) and bring the bechamel to the boil.
Once boiling, add the cream and gently whisk in.
On a very low heat stir in the grated cheese in stages, fully incorporating the cheese each time before adding more.
Turn off the heat, and if a cheese croquette is desired, cool the mix by spreading on a tray.
If a ham and cheese croquette is also desired, blend the ham into half of the cheese mixture, and similarly cool by spreading on a tray.
Cover to prevent a crust forming and place the tray into a refrigerator so the mix will solidify (this may take up to 20 minutes).

To form and cook the croquettes, using clean hands mould the croquettes into roughly equal size and roll in a tray of flour until fully covered. Then coat the croquettes with egg and roll in the breadcrumbs. Each croquette should then be deep fried in the oil at a temperature of 180C (350F) until the colour is golden – roughly one minute.
Preferably the croquettes should be cooked individually and treated gently so they don’t fracture.Eat hot served with deep fried parsley.

recipe.title: Croque Monsieur & Croque Madame
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A classic French sandwich filled with ham, cheese, and béchamel sauce.

Steps: To make the béchamel sauce, melt the butter over low heat in a medium-sized saucepan. Add the flour all at once to create a roux and stir with a wooden spoon until combined into a paste. Cook for 2 minutes, then remove from heat and set aside to cool.

Meanwhile, combine the milk, onion half, bay leaf, salt, pepper, nutmeg, and cayenne pepper in another medium-sized saucepan. Slowly bring to a light boil, stirring occasionally. Once the milk is warm, strain half of it over the cold roux and whisk to fully blend with the roux before adding the rest of the milk.

Return the saucepan to medium heat and continue stirring constantly until the sauce comes to a boil. Once the sauce begins to bubble, let it cook for 2 minutes, stirring a little faster to prevent bits from sticking to the bottom. Taste and adjust the seasoning to your liking, then remove from heat.
Add the cheese to the sauce and incorporate until melted.
Toast the bread slices and then coat each slice with butter. Spread a spoonful of béchamel sauce evenly over two slices of toast, followed by a layer of ham and then cheese.

For the croque monsieur, close the sandwich and spread a layer of béchamel sauce on top, followed by a sprinkle of cheese. For the croque madame, spread some béchamel sauce on the underside of the second slice of toast and then close the sandwich.
Place the sandwiches in the oven and bake for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, fry an egg for the croque madame.
Remove the sandwiches from the oven and place the fried egg on top of the croque madame. Serve and enjoy.

recipe.title: Fish Dugléré
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A French-inspired fish dish with a rich and creamy sauce.

Steps: Start by washing, peeling and cutting the vegetables.

To make the chopped tomatoes: plunge the tomatoes into boiling water for 30 seconds then take them out and plunge them into icy water. The skin should detach easily with a knife. Remove the skin, cut the tomatoes in half and remove the seeds with a teaspoon. Roughly chop the tomatoes.
Wash and clean the fish and cut the fins with kitchen shears. Pat the fish dry and then fillet each fish. Transfer the fish filets to a container and keep covered in the fridge.
Keep the fish bones in a pan with cold water ready to make the fish stock.
To prepare the fish fumet, place a large sauce pan on the stove on medium heat and melt the butter until it starts to foam.
Add the vegetables and cook for 2 minutes. Drain the fish bones and add them to the pan mixing well.
Pour in the white wine followed by enough water to just cover the fish bones. Add the bouquet garni and the salt and pepper.
Bring the stock to the boil then simmer for 25 minutes uncovered.
Filter the stock through a sieve into a separate container and leave to cool down.
While the stock is cooling down, prepare the rice, potatoes or sides you plan to serve with the fish.
To cook the fish, coat the bottom of a deep saute pan or large stainless saucepan with butter followed by some salt and pepper. Then sprinkle in the shallots, onions and parsley.

Place the fish filet over the garnish next to each other and pour in the wine (avoid pouring the wine directly on the fish filets to avoid them turning a dark greyish colour). Add some cold fish stock, 3 quarters of the way up to the fish filets. Then cover the fish with a circle of baking paper which will act as a lid.
Turn the heat to medium and bring slowly to a simmer. As soon as the stock is simmering, transfer the pan to a preheated oven at 170°C/338°F and cook for a maximum of 5 to 6 minutes.
As soon as the fish is out of the oven start making the sauce. Things have to happen quickly as your fish will starting cooling down.
Transfer the fish cooking juices to a clean large bottom pan (this will facilitate the reduction).

Reduce the the cooking juices to a syrupy consistency on high heat and then add the cream. Reduce by half until the sauce starts to thicken. Add the chopped tomatoes and stir gently taking care not to colour the sauce too much with the tomatoes.
Turn the heat off and add 20 grams of butter, stirring gently until the butter is melted into the sauce.
Serve immediately on individual plates or in a dish.

recipe.title: Poire à la Beaujolais
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: A classic French dessert recipe featuring poached pears in a rich Beaujolais syrup.

Steps: Pour the wine into a saucepan and add the peppercorns, cloves, orange peel, vanilla bean, half of the cinnamon stick (deseeded) and sugar. Warm the contents up to a gentle boil on a medium heat.
Peel the pears (leaving the stem in) and brush each of them thoroughly with the juice of half a lemon (this prevents discolouring). Reserve the pears in a clean container.
Remove part of the core of each pear as follows: Using a knife, cut out a ring at the bottom of the pear and then by using a micro melon baller or apple corer, gouge out the seeds and core.

Place the pears into the gently boiling syrup. Then reduce heat to minimum, cover the pan and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the pears are soft enough. Turn off the heat and remove the pears gently into another container to cool.
When the pears are in the container pour half a cup of warm syrup and 200 ml of crème de cassis over them.
Remove the orange peel from the remaining syrup and on medium heat reduce the syrup by about a quarter. Cool the syrup to luke warm.
Pour the cooled syrup through a sieve (to remove the flavourings) over the pears.
Cover the bowl with a wrap and place it in the fridge for 24 hours.

Serve cold with each pear in a dish into which some of the syrup has been poured as a bed. Sprinkle over some biscuit pieces or toasted almonds and pour as much remaining syrup over the pear as desired.

recipe.title: Gougère
recipe.creator: French Baker
recipe.description: Classic French choux pastry puffs topped with melted cheese.

Steps: Preheat oven to 200˚C (400 ˚F).
Place water, butter, salt and pepper into a saucepan on low heat. Bring to a simmer then turn off the heat.
Add flour and mix until ball of dough forms.
Transfer panade to a large bowl and allow to cool down.
Beat eggs in a dish. Grate cheese.
Tip half of beaten egg into bowl and mix with panade, then slowly add remaining egg and continue to mix.
Mix in cheese and nutmeg. Refrigerate for 1 hour if desired.
Pipe individual dollops onto baking tray or silicone mat. Brush each with egg wash and top with grated cheese.
Bake at 200˚C (400 ˚F) for 20-25 minutes, then reduce heat to 150˚C (302 ˚F) and cook for a further 15 minutes.

recipe.title: Chicken Papillotes
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender chicken papillotes with a tangy and creamy sauce.

Steps: Fry each side of the chicken breasts for 2 – 2 ½ minutes in one tablespoon of olive oil on medium-high heat or until lightly colored. Transfer the chicken to a plate and leave to cool.
Reduce the heat and sauté the shallots for 1 – 2 minutes.
Whisk the crème fraiche, the mustard and the salt and pepper in a bowl until well integrated.
Preheat your oven to 180C (356F) (fanforced).
When the chicken has cooled, lay each piece on a square of baking (parchment) paper and use a brush to coat each side with the mustard mix.
Top each breast with the herbs and a slice of lemon, some peppercorns, a drizzle of olive oil, and parsley. You can also add chilli or basil.
Fold the paper lengthwise two or three times to enclose the chicken, and twist each end to seal in the ingredients.
Bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
Unwrap the parcel or cut it with scissors and serve with a vegetable side.

recipe.title: LEMON & GARLIC CHICKEN
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Moist and flavorful chicken dish with a tangy lemon and garlic sauce.

Steps: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper, and dust them with flour.
Bring the stock to a gentle boil and add the garlic slices and leave to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and sear them until golden brown on all sides (approximately 5 minutes per side). Once done, transfer the chicken to a plate and reserve the excess cooking fat in a small bowl.
Reduce the heat to medium and add the bay leaves to the pot. Once hot, add the shallots and cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly.
Deglaze the pot with wine and cook for a few minutes until the liquid becomes slightly syrupy, then add the stock and bring to a boil.

Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius / 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Season the stock, then add the herbs and lemon pieces. Return the chicken thighs to the pot and moisten them by drizzling with the reserved cooking fat. Cover with a lid and cook in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes.

Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the pot and set it aside. Finish the sauce on the stove by bringing the liquid to a gentle boil and reducing it for a few minutes to concentrate the flavor and thicken the sauce slightly.

For the purists, ladle the sauce over the chicken as is. For a creamy sauce, add an equal amount of cream (up to 150 ml) to the sauce. Bring the sauce to a boil and reduce it until it is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. To finish, taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning to your liking.
Transfer the chicken to a serving dish, ladle the sauce over, and garnish with fresh herbs and thin slices of fresh lemon.

recipe.title: Pasta Salad with Fresh Herbs
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A refreshing salad with pasta and fresh herbs, perfect for a light meal.

Steps: Flash-fry the garlic in olive oil over medium heat for about 20 seconds. Season well with salt and pepper and leave in the pan.
Cook the pasta until al dente and drain, then mix with the fried garlic and oil in the pan to coat the pasta in the oil. Allow to cool.
In a bowl, dissolve the salt and pepper in lemon juice. Add parsley, basil, and mint and whisk together.
Combine the pasta and lemon juiced herbs in another bowl and toss well.
Adjust the seasoning and drizzle more olive oil and lemon juice to taste. Grate some lemon zest over and toss well.
Serve in separate bowls with a little more parsley and lemon juice and top with grated parmesan cheese.

recipe.title: Beurre Rouge
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic red wine sauce for fish or steaks.

Steps: Mise en place: Prepare all ingredients before cooking.
Dice the mushrooms, shallots, and carrots. Peel the garlic and bruise it slightly.
Add dry ingredients to a large sauté pan with tomato paste, port wine, and red wine. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-high and let reduce by half before turning off heat.
Strain the reduction through a sieve into a saucepan, pressing the aromatic garnish to extract liquid.
Reduce the wine until you have about four tablespoons of liquid left and the consistency becomes semi-syrupy.
Finish the sauce by gradually adding cold butter, whisking constantly. Continue this process until all butter is incorporated.
Adjust seasoning with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately or keep warm in a double boiler at around 45°C (115°F) until ready to serve.

recipe.title: Sweet Soufflé Omelet with Cointreau
recipe.creator: unknown
recipe.description: A French-inspired dessert omelet with a sweet and airy soufflé center, flambéed with Cointreau.

Steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) convection heat. Prepare a nonstick frying pan and a stand or electric mixer.
In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together egg yolks, sugar, and Cointreau until the mixture is whitish and almost foamy.
Whisk egg whites on medium speed until they double in volume, then raise speed to form stiff peaks.
Combine meringue with egg yolk mixture, then fold in rest of meringue to create soufflé mixture.
Cook soufflé mixture in pan over high heat, then reduce heat and cook for 2-3 minutes. Flip omelet onto plate and fold second half over.
Bake omelet in oven for 3-5 minutes, or until firm. Ignite Cointreau and pour over omelet for flambé. Serve immediately.

recipe.title: Caprese Cucumber Salad
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A simple and delicious salad with the flavors of Italy.

Steps: Cut the cucumber into slices and set aside.
Wash and slice the tomatoes.
Crumble the mozzarella cheese and place in a bowl.
Add sliced cucumbers, tomatoes, salt, and pepper to the bowl.
Sprinkle with fresh basil leaves and serve.

recipe.title: Hay Baked Chicken
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Impress your guests with this unique hay-baked chicken recipe.

Steps: Preheat the oven (fan forced) to 190C (374F).

Line a cast iron pot with a generous quantity of hay to create a “nest” for the chicken to lie on. Make sure the hay reaches all the way up the sides and that there is no hay sitting on the rim of the pot.

Make a stiff dough out of the flour and water and roll it to a length which will cover the circumference of the pot. Lay the dough to entirely cover the rim. Place the lid on top and press down firmly to create a tight seal.
Place the chicken into the middle shelf of the oven and let it cook until ready – in the case of a 1.5kg chicken, 65 minutes will do.
The aroma of cooked chicken flowing from the oven is an indicator that the chicken is cooked. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest in the pot for at least 20 minutes.
Remove the lid and take the chicken out. Place it under a grill for 5 minutes to colour the breast (this is optional).
Season the top with a grind of black pepper and a little rock salt and brush with the melted salted butter.

recipe.title: Crème aux Oeufs
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Classic French dessert with creamy custard and a hint of vanilla.

Steps: Warm the milk in a small saucepan over medium heat with the vanilla bean.
Preheat your oven at 150°C (300 °F).
In a bowl, mix the sugar, whole eggs, and yolks together until the sugar has mostly dissolved.
Once the milk is warm, pour half of it through a fine mesh into the egg mixture and mix gently to combine. Then, stir in the rest of the milk.
Set up a bain-marie by placing a dish to cook the custard in a large roasting pan. Carefully ladle the custard mixture into the dish.

Now, pull the middle tray of your oven slightly out and place the roasting pan with the custard on it. Pour enough warm water into the roasting pan until it reaches three-quarters of the way up the dish containing the custard. Slowly slide the oven tray back into the oven.

Bake the custard for 20-25 minutes until it feels semi-solid to the touch but still has a wobble to it. (If using a dish deeper than 5 cm / 3 inches, you may need to bake the custard for longer.) To check if the dessert is ready, insert a knife into the custard, and if it comes out clean, it's done.

When cooked, take the pan with the custard out of the bain-marie and leave it to cool completely at room temperature. For a more rustic look, once cool, place the custard under the grill (broiler) for around 5 minutes to brown the top.
Serve the dessert as is or refrigerate before serving cold.

recipe.title: POTAGE DUBARRY
recipe.creator: Dubarry
recipe.description: Creamy potato and cauliflower soup.

Steps: Peel and quarter the potatoes, then add them to a saucepan filled with cold water and a teaspoon of coarse salt. Bring to a boil and cook for 20 minutes. Once cooked, drain and return the potatoes to the saucepan. Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of milk and mash them with a fork. Set aside when ready.

To cook the cauliflower, fill another saucepan with water, add a tablespoon of coarse salt, and bring it to a boil. Submerge the cauliflower and cook for 18 minutes. Once ready, drain the water and return the cauliflower to the saucepan.

For the potage, bring 500 ml of the stock to a quick boil in a saucepan. When ready, immediately pour it over the cauliflower and use a stick blender to process the mixture. Add the remaining 100 ml of stock and 150 grams of the potato puree. Process again until smooth.

Pass the mixture through a sieve into a clean saucepan and bring it to a simmer over medium heat. Taste the potage, adjust the seasoning with salt, then add the cream and mix well. Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook the potage, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes.

When the soup is hot enough, stir in the white pepper. To serve, divide into soup bowls and garnish with parsley and a few pan-fried croutons. You can also decorate the potage with a sprinkle of parboiled small cauliflower florets for added texture.

recipe.title: Puff Pastry
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic pastry recipe for making puff pastry from scratch.

Steps: Cube the butter and sprinkle over flour. Rub butter into flour until well incorporated but not to bread crumb stage.
Add a little water at a time and blend by hand until a ball of dough forms that does not stick to bowl.
Form dough into rectangular shape, wrap in cling wrap, and rest in fridge for 30 minutes or longer.
Dust work bench lightly with flour and roll out rectangle lengthwise to measure 45 cm by 15 cm.
Brush off excess flour, fold back 15 cm of dough towards yourself, then fold remaining 15 cm over top to form 15 cm square.
Flatten parcel a little, turn 90 degrees, roll out to 45 cm by 15cm rectangle, and repeat steps for another 2 times.
Rest pastry in fridge for 15 minutes before rolling out into desired shape.

recipe.title: Salmon & Veloute
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Delicious salmon with a creamy velouté sauce.

Steps: Preheat the oven at 50 ℃ (122 °F).
Make the roux by melting the butter in a pan over low-medium heat. Whisk in the flour, then reduce the heat to low and cook for a 2 – 2 ½ minutes.
To shallow poach the fish, pour the cider into a frying pan and add the fish, shallots and bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper.
Coat one side of the parchment paper with butter and pierce a hole in the centre. Place the lid butter side down on top of the fish and tuck into the pan to completely enclose the fish.
Bring the cider to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and leave the fish to cook for between 8 to 12 minutes depending on the thickness of the fillets.
When cooked, transfer the fish to a plate and spoon a little of the cooking liquid on top. Keep warm in the oven covered with the parchment paper while you prepare the velouté.

Filter the remaining cooking liquid into the pan with the roux and whisk to combine the ingredients, then place over medium heat whisking constantly until the velouté thickens before stirring in the cream.
Cook the velouté for 1-2 minutes, adjust the seasoning and add the lemon juice.
Remove the fish from the oven and whisk in the excess fish juices from the plate into the velouté.
Serve the fish immediately drizzled with the velouté and garnished with chives.

recipe.title: Brioche
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French bread recipe with a rich, buttery flavor.

Steps: Place dry ingredients into the mixer bowl and blend together with a spatula.
Start the machine and slowly add eggs. Mix for about 6 minutes until the dough doesn't stick to the bowl surface.
Slowly add the butter cut into smallish cubes at room temperature. A room temperature of 21C is optimal. Mix (knead) for up to 20 minutes – until the dough starts to detach from the bowl.
Scrape the dough into a glass bowl and cover with film wrap. Leave to rest for 1-2 hours until the dough has doubled in size. Turn the dough out onto a floured bench.
Press down on the dough to force out the gas until it is back to its original size.
Return the dough to the glass bowl, cover with a tight-fitting plastic wrap and place into the fridge for 1 ¼ to 1 ½ hours.
Whilst waiting, prepare the cake tin by greasing with butter if necessary and lining with baking (parchment) paper.
Once the dough has risen a second time, flatten once more to remove the gas, form the dough into an oblong shape and cut into 3 with a pastry cutter.
Fit the 3 pieces into the cake tin and allow to rest and rise for a further 15-30 minutes at room temperature.
Pre-heat the oven to 180C fan forced.
Brush the tops of the dough with egg wash and then with kitchen scissors cut a cross into each of the 3 pieces.
Bake in the oven for about 25 minutes (if after 20 minutes the brioche looks too coloured, lower the temperature a little).

recipe.title: French-Style Tabbouleh Salad
recipe.creator: Unknown Chef
recipe.description: A refreshing French-inspired salad with bulgur wheat, cherry tomatoes, and fresh herbs.

Steps: Rinse the bulgur wheat in a fine mesh sieve over a bowl. Let it sit in about 750 ml of boiling water for 10-20 minutes, then drain.
Prepare the ingredients as stated above.
Scrape the bulgur wheat onto a paper-lined tray and let it sit for a few minutes to absorb any excess moisture. Then transfer the bulgur wheat to a salad bowl.
Add the tomatoes, shallot, spring onion, and herbs to the bowl and mix well with the bulgur.
Pour in the lemon juice and mix well before stirring in the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.

recipe.title: Sauteed Courgettes with Chorizo
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Tender courgettes sautéed with chorizo and topped with coriander and lemon zest.

Steps: Cut the chorizo into medium-sized cubes.
Remove the ends of the courgettes and use a vegetable peeler to peel strips off, leaving a 1 cm gap of skin between each strip. Cut each courgette into slices and transfer to a bowl.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a non-stick pan over high heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook for about 1 minute until the seeds start to pop.
Add the onions and sauté for about 5 minutes until lightly browned. Transfer the onions to a bowl.

Heat another tablespoon of oil in the same pan and add the courgettes. Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and sauté for 6-8 minutes, tossing occasionally to evenly cook the courgettes.
Add the onions back in and cook for a further minute or so before removing from the heat.
In a separate pan, pan-fry the chorizo for 2 minutes, tossing occasionally, until browned. Drain the chorizo on paper towel to remove excess fat.
To serve, place the courgette slices on a plate and sprinkle with the chorizo. Garnish with coriander and lemon zest and serve immediately.

recipe.title: French Custard
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic French custard recipe for puddings and tarts.

Steps: Pre-heat oven to 160C (320F).
Bring milk and vanilla pod and beans to a simmer.
Whisk eggs and sugar until sugar is dissolved. Add hot milk through a sieve bit by bit, whisking each portion into the mixture before adding the next.
Pour mix into a ramekin, place in a small roasting pan with boiling water halfway up, and bake for 30 minutes to set custard.
For Vanilla Custard Sauce: Bring milk and vanilla to a simmer. Whisk in egg yolks only and sugar until sugar is dissolved.
Add hot milk through a sieve bit by bit, whisking each portion into the mixture before adding the next.
Return mixture to saucepan over medium heat, whisking constantly, until temperature reaches 82C (180F).
Pour custard through a sieve into a container and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 12 hours to allow flavors to infuse.
For Pastry Cream: Bring milk and vanilla to a simmer. Whisk in egg yolks only and sugar until sugar is dissolved, then whisk in flour and corn starch until thick paste forms.
Cool sieved milk slightly, then pour it bit by bit into the mixture, whisking all the time.
Return mixture to pan over medium heat, whisking continually until custard boils, then reduce heat to low and whisk for a further minute.

recipe.title: Chicken Fricassée
recipe.creator: French Chef
recipe.description: Classic French dish with tender chicken and rich creamy sauce.

Steps: Warm a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat with 40 grams of butter. When the butter starts to chant, add the chicken to the pot and let it sizzle until lightly colored (about 3 minutes on each side). Cook in batches if needed. When done, set the chicken pieces aside for now.
Using the same pot, melt 20 grams of butter over low heat, then add the onions and mushrooms, and cook for a few minutes to release the flavors. Remove from the pot and set aside.
Return the chicken pieces to the pot, sprinkle the flour over and mix everything together. Then pour in the wine, add the onions and mushroom along with any leftover chicken bits.
Cover with water until it barely covers the chicken then bring to a simmer. As soon as the liquid starts to simmer, add the bouquet garni, bay leaf and carrots.
Partly cover the pot with the lid and let the chicken cook for about 40 minutes.
When cooked, remove the chicken legs from the pot and discard the chicken bits and bouquet garni. Add the legs to the plate with the breasts and let them rest while you make the sauce.

To make the sauce, bring the cooking liquid to a boil, then stir in the cream. Wait for the boil to return then let the sauce reduce for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to concentrate and the sauce to thicken.

When ready or just before serving, whisk the egg yolk with a few tablespoons of the warm sauce in a bowl. Then with the heat off, add the egg yolk mixture to the pot and stir to bind the sauce. Adjust the seasoning to taste and sprinkle generously with chopped parsley. Return the chicken to the pot and let sit until warm enough to serve.

recipe.title: SEARED SCALLOPS WITH CRÈME D’ÉCHALOTES
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: Delicate seared scallops served with a rich and creamy sauce.

Steps: Start the sauce by combining shallots, white wine, tarragon, and crushed black pepper. Simmer until the liquid reduces to an almost dry state.
Stir in cream and simmer for 8-10 minutes. Whisk in cold butter until fully incorporated.
Pass the sauce through a fine sieve into a clean pan. Stir in cayenne pepper and adjust seasoning with salt if needed.
Heat a sauté pan over medium heat and melt a nub of butter. Sear scallops for about 2 minutes on each side.
Remove from heat immediately to avoid overcooking. Spoon warm sauce onto plates, place seared scallops on top, and garnish with chives, tarragon, and citrus.

recipe.title: CLASSIC ONION SOUP
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A classic onion soup recipe with caramelized onions and melted cheese.

Steps: Peel, wash, and finely slice the onions (or use a food processor).
Make a bouquet garni (with leek, celery, thyme, 1 bay leaf, and parsley tied together).
Heat up the stock (homemade or top quality ready-made stock) and leave to simmer.

Melt the butter in a cast iron or thick bottom pan and add the onions. Stir well and season with salt and pepper. Then cook the onions on medium heat for 30 minutes until brown (stir regularly to ensure the onions are evenly browned).
Add the stock a little at a time, stirring gently. Add the bouquet garni and let the soup cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Place baguette slices on the bottom of a small bowl or dish, pour in some soup (3/4 from the top), and then add a few more slices of bread on top.
Cover the bread with a generous amount of comte cheese and place the dish(es) under the grill for a few minutes until the cheese has melted and a crust is formed.
Serve immediately.

recipe.title: CHICKEN
recipe.creator: GASTON GERARD
recipe.description: Delicious chicken dish with a creamy sauce and crunchy breadcrumbs.

Steps: Cut chicken into pieces. Keep the carcass and trim the drumsticks and wings.
In a cast iron pot on medium heat, pour in the oil and add the butter to melt.
Add the chicken pieces and season with salt and pepper. Sear until lightly coloured, 3-4 minutes on each side. Remove and set aside.
Add the carcass pieces to the pot and turn the heat to medium-low. Arrange the chicken pieces on top of the carcass.
Sprinkle paprika on top, place the lid on and reduce heat to low. Cook for 35-40 minutes.
Discard the carcass and place the chicken pieces into a shallow pan or ovenproof dish. Cover with foil and keep warm in the oven at 60 °C (140 °F).
For the sauce: Place the pan with the paprika/chicken cooking liquid on high heat and bring to boil. Add 100g / 3.5 oz cheese and stir to melt.
Add wine and bring to a boil for 3 minutes. Add ½ cup cream and boil to reduce the liquid, around 5-6 minutes until it reaches “spoon-coating” consistency.
Remove the pan from the heat and add the Dijon mustard. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning if desired.
Pour the sauce over the chicken pieces and grate the remaining cheese on top. Then sprinkle with breadcrumbs and broil for 5-10 minutes or until a light crust forms on top.

recipe.title: Sauce Vierge
recipe.creator: Unknown
recipe.description: A flavorful and aromatic sauce recipe.

Steps: Place the crushed garlic into some olive oil.
Warm the olive oil, garlic, tomatoes, shallots, and coriander seeds on low to medium heat, blending the ingredients together with a wooden spoon.
Reduce the heat to very low and simmer for 5-6 minutes.
Stir in the balsamic vinegar and herbs, and leave to sit for 2-3 minutes.
Adjust the seasoning to taste, add a little sugar, and blend in. Leave a little longer to further infuse.
